text: We traveled to the North Michigan Avenue in Chicago for hot meal(dinner), and they have jazz with a three combo. We get seat about 7:50 pm for 7:45 reservation, we were a tad last. The spinach dip was very good, and they left the salt shaker in the kitchen.  The lack of salt was great for me. Roc has the trout and she was very thankful. The Seattle-Style BBQ salmon was on point with the pommé purée and broccoli . They service honey for sweeting my cup of tea. The desserts were hit and miss. The miss was the apple walnut cobbler with a side of vanilla ice cream. The apples and nuts were better on the tree. The milk for the ice cream missed it calling as ice cream. Now for the banana cream pie with whipped  cream, caramel sauce, sliced bananas (huge), and shaved dark chocolate was good...... I would get a taffy apple from Old Town Fudge Pot next time . The company for dining was over the top.... Shalom

It gets a little tricky to find a good dining spot on Michigan Avenue despite all the great retail going on on this street. Bandera, however, salvages this situation. I came here for lunch and was blown away by the quality of food, the speed, quality and efficiency of service as well as the atmosphere in general. The corn bread is an absolute MUST ORDER item. Please get it and you'll understand why. I was so blown away by how perfect the crust was and the sweetness balanced with savory flavor profiles was amazing, not to mention the soft (almost custard-like) texture... can you tell I'm in love?!  I also ordered the lamb sandwich with coleslaw as side and it was delicious and comes in a huge portion so I ended up taking half a sandwich home.  Pricing is pretty reasonable for a restaurant on Michigan Ave and the server could not have been more friendly. Solid spot!

We'll run restaurant used to be a favorite.  Maybe an off-night , server didn't visit table for over 5 minutes after seating at 7:50 for a 7:30 rezo. Chicken salad should have chicken in it ! Had plenty of fried corn bread croutons and dates with maybe 2 or 3 ounces of shredded chicken bits. Probably will not return until different concept takes over this beautiful space .

oh my god, the cornbread. basically i eat the ahi tuna salad (huge!) plus cornbread and i explode after of full-ness and happiness. Mouth is actually watering right now thinking about the cornbread. It's not necessarily an exciting or exotic place, as it is American food, but those two items hit it out of the park.

Best veggie burger I've ever had. Really well done food. Also of course, can't beat the atmosphere. Open late, even on Sundays. Bartender was great and served also one of the best old fashions I've ever had as well. Definitely eat at Bandera if you're in Chicago.
Food was soooooo good! Loved the ambiance and service staff. Will come again when we are back in Chicago!

I cheated on my husband with Bandera's Macho salad and homemade Oreo ice cream sandwich dessert! Not to mention the incredible trip tip enchilada. A well seasoned pork fillet. A girls weekend away in Chicago! Perfect stop for an amazing meal to remember that we gals will remember for awhile. Got started off with the macho salad as an appetizer we all shared and their homemade corn bread. These two alone gave a song to our tastebuds to sing! Macho salad has a great dressing, creamy goat cheese and avocado, just delish! Cornbread like never before, it's out of this world good. A little more moist than usual cornbread and a crunchy top crust that's addictive. My tri tip beef medallion paired with a hearty sized duo sauces enchilada was a great pairing. Only complaint of mine was the beef was a little fatty. The companion ladies ordered the juicy amazing rotisserie chicken & beef BBQ ribs, also just perfectly seasoned with good flavor but not over powering, a great balance of textures and flavor. My aunt ordered the pork fillet that was fabulous but a little dry, very well seasoned. I just had to have the homemade Oreo ice cream sandwich with homemade ice cream! It has an espresso sauce I wanted to roll around in and slurp all day! Just a feast for royalty! I haven't had a meal that left me this smitten in years. Great staff and service! Can't wait to return!

My cousin from NYC was in town and asked to do a little bit of sightseeing. She was staying near Mag Mile so we decided to find something with decent views and drinks. We came across this place and it looked decent so we decided to try. We ordered a pleasant bottle of wine, I had the kale salad and both my cousin and fiance ordered the burger. The burgers were alright, but the fries were pretty tasty. My kale salad, however, was excellent! The vinaigrette and the chicken was perfect, even my fiancé who doesn't like veggies enjoyed it :P They didnt have accommodations for children so we had our toddler sitting in one of the chairs, and surprisingly kept her entertained. The view of the city is spectacular to go with your meal. The only complaint I have is that I think our waitress forgot about us when we ordered an espresso (she was great all along), and waited about 10 minutes before I had to flag someone down for the check and the espresso.

A solid 3.5 stars. Likes - Great live jazz from 6pm onwards - French dip sandwich was juicy, tender, and definitely worth it - Lamb sandwich was very moist and soft, and the roasted peppers were a great touch Dislikes - Cornbread appetizer was horrible. Smelled and looked great but dry and tasteless. We couldn't even finish.  - Gravy that came with the lamb sandwich was tasteless and too thin but this didn't detract from the sandwich
Food and service here are great.  Limited menu (2-page only) but what they have they do well.  The prime rib sandwich was excellent, so was the smoked salmon. Service is efficient and polite.

I love Bandera so much I applied to work here in the winter of 2016. I got through the first round of interviews and into the restaurant for a sit down interview. I had a feeling it went well and touched base about a callback, but never received one. I followed up and again was met with silence. When they posted another job opening in the summer of 2017, I applied again, reminding them they already had my application on file. Again, silence. I won't be back as a potential employee or as a customer.

Excellent food. A little pricy but big portions and great quality. Dutch chicken is excellent, I had the ahi tuna avocado salad which was terrific. Corn bread was good...no different than any other corn bread but good!  Nice jazz band playing in the background. Good drinks and ambience.

Wow! What a wonderful experience! We have always loved the food. Get the cornbread skillet and the dip duo. You can't go wrong there! We make it to the restaurant weekly. It's one of our favorite spots!

Omg this restaurant is extra classy! I visited with a group of friends for my birthday! We ordered the seafood tower it had oysters, clams, crab, shrimp, and lobster it was devine.  We sat outside and our server was very attentive and pleasant.  I ordered the New York  strip with mac and cheese and spinach. Everything was delish! My server even brought me a special dessert to help celebrate my birthday. It's pricey but it's worth every penny.

After 6pm you're rewarded with a simply unbeatable vibe thanks to some of the best live jazz music playing while you soak in the rest of the vibe at this place. But it's not just the music, my knife cut through their prime rib like butter. My girlfriend had an also delicious short rib. I recommend the salmon and jumbo shrimp for starters, as well as the duo dips. Everybody ordered the signature cornbread which we ordered too but found it wasn't all that. We ended our lovely meal with an incredibly delicious apple cobbler with walnuts that I would strongly recommend. Overall a 5* experience. Get the window seats!

Beautiful views of The Mag Mile and excellent music! I would come here just for the live jazz and great views of the city. This is the place for an after work drink with friends or a stop on your date night! We had two appetizers because we couldn't decided between the jalapeño corn bread and the smoke salmon dip! Both were so good we could have left after those! We had drinks at the bar before we sat down to a cozy both near the live three piece jazz band. Our server was knowledgable and quick to serve us. Our main course was the prime rib which was enormous and juicy as it should be. And I had a French dip sandwich which was savory and garlicy just as I like it! I highly recommend this restaurant for a date night or a girls night out!
This is my go to spot to take family or friends who are visiting. I particularly like the kale chicken salad, and usually order a few smaller dishes to share

Went here recommended by Chicago locals. They are right...this place is great. Their drinks are very good. We had their crispy chicken sandwich and the rotisserie lamp sandwich. Both are delicious with the chicken being the best. This is not a $$ place...more like $$$.

I was brought here by a friend. This is a wonderful place. It's a wonderful mix of old school traditional with modern touches. The service is as good as I've ever seen. As a former CEC, I know when I see a front room working as a team. Many of the servers have been there 20 plus years. They are warm, attentive and move smoothly through the room. Every course and every drink was delivered by someone else. Because they don't keep their guests waiting. Live Jazz. Wonderful. Paul Martin Trio on Wednesday and the room was full, with people in line. Volume was perfect, tempo was great and the selections were great. A few Sinatra songs and I was in heaven. The drinks are made beautifully by real, experienced bartenders. I tried both old fashioned's and manhattans. Even their well brands are strong. My friend had a filet that was perfectly prepared. I picked a simple fish, just see how they would do. It was Country Chicken. You can't hide a badly prepared chicken this way, and I was pleased. It was moist, flavorful and I enjoyed it- hell I enjoyed my entire evening. As I'm traveling here at often, I'm looking forward to becoming a regular.  There are fancier places. There are Michelin starred places. But for the value, intimacy and service, this is a winner

Hillstone restaurants are always consistent.  That's what makes them Hillstone!  Bandera Chicago is no exception.  Interior is dark and comfortable. Menu has variety and the food is delicious all around.  Cocktails are good, though not exceptional.  Great to have a standby stalwart for when you are looking for a place to dine in an unfamiliar city, and nightly jazz to boot.   It's a little tricky to find, as it's on the second floor with a non-descript door on Grand Ave. leading up to it, so be aware.

Loved the ambience. Nice lighting.  Nice jazz music.  Good view Michigan  Ave. Loved the service.  Loved the food.  Our server Macie was so very pleasant and efficient.  We never felt rushed or ignored.  My husband had the French dip sandwich and I had the Pine salad and lamb sandwich.  Nice salad with toasted almonds  and best sandwiches.  Fresh in house made bread.   Wonderful roasted peppers, fresh and flavorful arugula with a touch of mint on my lamb sandwich.  Tender meat and awesome au jus on both of our sandwiches.  Messy but yummy.  We left very full, satisfied and happy.

Great place to go on a dinner date with your partner. Summary of our experience: *great food *great view of Michigan ave (window table)  *live jazz music that set a relaxing/romantic vibe  *phenomenal service

I love this place!! Be sure to make a reservation or you could be waiting a long time for a table. The autmosphere is moody, dim lights, live music, and lots of noise from the busy environment. If you go during artichoke season you have to get one. They're so yummy, I wish they could have them all year around. All entrees I have had have been fantastic and some have had unique flavor combos which make them fun and different. But let's talk about the dessert you have to save room for it. The Oreo cookie with ice cream is my favorite.

Came here on a Sunday evening to have a drink and listen to Jazz. The atmosphere is very calm and relaxing. I sat at the bar and had a vodka pomegranate martini. The jazz was a little disappointing but not bad. I decided to eat something and chose the rotisserie lamb sandwich which is amazing but messy. Service is excellent. Definitely a place I would come back to if I am ever back in Chicago.

We have Houston's Restaurants where we live so we were anxious to try Bandera by the same Hillstone Restaurant group when we were visiting Chicago. We had a 6:45 reservation on a Saturday and the restaurant was bustling and active when we arrived but we were seated in a corner booth (always a plus when you are dining with kids) right away. We started with the spinach and artichoke dip and it was delicious. My husband had the Cajun trout and I had the BBQ salmon. The trout was very good but the salmon was A-MAZING! Both were very large pieces of fish cooked perfectly. The trout was spicy but not overly. The salmon melted in your mouth. You had your choice of 2 sides with the fish dishes. They also have several options that aren't on the menu for kids; grilled cheese or a hamburger or you can get a smaller portion of an entree from the menu. The wait staff was very attentive. The meal was more than we normally spend but the food quality and service justified the cost. We will definitely be back!

This is always my "go to" restaurant when I have a few friends visiting or want a relaxing, intimate dinner with someone. The ambience is good and the food is too. I highly recommend all of their salads. I am normally not a big salad person, but their salads are exceptional!

Visiting from out of town and I do not know if the chefs or cooks they had were new or unaware of how to properly to cook steak, and I do understand it is not a steak house. We were with a group of friends and I did not want to cause any discomfort among them and cause a scene but we ordered two steaks one medium rare and one rare and they were both served medium well, nearly well done. The quality of the meat and crust were superb but the degree of doneness was unfortunately extremely unsatisfactory.
Great prices, great food, and cool atmosphere. I had a delicious steak here. I would definitely come back next time when I'll be in Chicago!

Had lunch here in late April with friends.  Service was pretty good. Artichokes - delicious, with good sauce. Hard to share three artichoke halves among four people, but we managed. Veggie burger - way too much between two buns and so it was a huge mess to eat - I wish I had some warning about this before ordering it. Additionally, not only was there a bean patty, but there was a substantial amount of rice in the sandwich. I've had better veggie burgers in other places. I know my husband enjoyed what he ate (though I don't remember what that was).  I would return here, but would choose something different to eat.

Bandera is in a convenient downtown location on Michigan Avenue.  I've dined here several times and the service is always exceptional.  My most recent visit was last night; they sat us right on time for our reservation.  The hostess was very professional and our waitress was excellent.  The food is amazing; I've tried several menu options and none have disappointed.  It's dimly lit (romantic) and they have live jazz in the evening time (at least on the weekends which I've dined). It is in downtown so you may want to take a Cab or a rideshare service if you don't wish to deal with the traffic and hassles of paying for parking.  Anticipate spending $100-$125 for two people.  I will definitely return and recommend to others.

Oh My Gosh-You must go here. We sat at the bar because there was a 45 minute wait, so make reservations. We like sitting at the bar, however. Anyway, this place is too cool. All the help is dressed in classy outfits. The bartenders in suit and tie, servers in all black, with ties, etc. Live jazz playing every night. I had a Veggie Burger ($18) and coleslaw. Very good. My wife had a Cheeseburger ($19) with Parmesan mashed potatoes as her side and she loved it. We both had a 7oz. pour of Zinfandel. The ambiance was the best. Not the cheapest place in town, but worth it. Great service and delivered in a confident, unassuming manner.
Excellent all American restaurant.  Fantastic meat with the ability to make chicken or pork exquisite. Fantastic friendly respectful service with sizeable attention.  Great location and not touristy.

Great location, quality food, incredible service and a place that ideal for casual get togethers or special events as it's just a solid, well run restaurant.  Not too nice and not too casual.  Only wish they had a few more entree options but that's the only knock as each dish that they serve is absolutely delicious.  Such a beautiful, second story location overlooking Michigan Avenue.  Highly recommend.

Went tonight (sat night) between 6-6:30pm and had about 40-45min wait.  Started with drinks, martini and champagne, which were good. Bartender was friendly and served us quickly even though she was busy.  Once seated, we started with the guac/queso dip. It was good but small portion for the price. My 16 yr son who usually orders burgers, raved about his cheeseburger...said the bun was really good. Only small complaint was he asked for medium and it was slightly undercooked. My daughter and I shared the caesar salad and bbq ribs. Caesar was good but was too heavy on the dressing. We both liked the flavor of the ribs. My husband ordered the rotisserie chicken/bbq ribs and asked to have fries. The waitress mistakenly said the dish already was served with fries. My husband said he thought ribs were overcooked, chicken was just luke warm/didn't have any flavor, and didn't get his fries until the rest of us were already done with our meals.  Waitress didn't check on us after meals were served, so I had to flag her down and asked for ketchup and complained about the chicken. Another woman that wasn't our waitress (maybe manager) asked how our meals were and offered my husband another rotisserie chicken or more ribs but my husband declined since he didn't enjoy the dish. They took his meal off our bill but my husband left hungry which was disappointing since it was our last night in Chicago.  If up to my husband, he'd give restaurant two stars. But since the kids and I enjoyed ours, I gave it 3 stars.  Although lighting was dark like others have mentioned, good atmosphere with good live jazz.

Great service, quality food, live jazz band.  What's not to like!  Prices are as expected on the mile, coming from NYC, I think it is very reasonable for the portion and quality, We ordered the beef back ribs, prime ribs, cheese burger and artichoke dip. BBQ ribs are fall of the bone goodness, well marinated and tender prime ribs, warm soft bun for the burger.   Our server Cira was wonderful - friendly and attentive.  Thank you helpers for the good recommendation!

For some reason, I had neglected going to this place for a few years, but I was pleasantly surprised when I returned recently. It's really a great place that has held up very well among a lot of newer offerings. The food is top notch in its class and the atmosphere has a mid-century club feel that is still very cool. Get a table facing the avenue if you can.  They have a great menu. The burgers and the macho salad are standouts. Service is fine. Prices are borderline high, but you're on Michigan Avenue.

Highly recommend. Food was great and service was professional and efficient. Had the Caesar salad which was crisp and beautifully presented. French dip sandwich was one of the best I have ever had. Sat by window looking out on Michigan Avenue and listened to live jazz throughout dinner.  Cornbread is one of their signature items and was tasty. Classy but not stuffy atmosphere. Overall a great dining experience.

If you missed this restaurant you're in for a real treat. It's sort of a Hidden Gem on Michigan Avenue because it's on a second-floor hard to see from the street it is right across from the Marriott next to Men's Wearhouse. I was pleasantly surprised when I found it many years ago because it has such a wonderful ambience and they play live jazz nightly which is a big plus for me.  They really have a nice variety on their menu with delicious healthy food.  It's always very happening, be prepared for a little bit of a wait but it's worth it. Definitely get a reservation, and here's a tip... you can request  a table by the window which overlooks Michigan Avenue. I've had a lot of entrees, the fish is wonderful but I always crave the lamb sandwich which I find outstanding, with a side of the kale salad which is also top-notch.  Bandera has a nice sized bar overlooking the restaurant which some patrons even choose to eat dinner at.  If you like my review please don't forget to check the like button. Hope you enjoy your dinner I always do. thank you

Lunch at Bandera was a nice surprise.  The setting felt like dinner with low lighting and a full restaurant.  The cornbread as an appetizer was great.  Nice texture and very fresh, add a little honey and it was fantastic.  We split the burger (which came out in thirds).  Fresh bread, fresh veggies and well cooked but still seemed expensive.  As did the $6 side of cucumber salad but it was so good.  Worth the visit especially if you share plates.

a fun and entertaining place to eat!  Recommendation: try the Seattle Salmon with the Kale salad I love Bandera with the cool jazz club vibe, comfortable seating and amazing food. The menu is simple, but the food is incredible. The live music really adds a cool vibe to the restaurant.  This is a fun place to eat and the staff treat the customers really well. You definitely need to eat here. It is worth the wait.

Hillstone restaurant group has honestly some of the most delicious food that restaurants can offer. Being from Dallas I've visited all 3 of their locations out there often and Bandera does not disappoint! Sadly, they don't have artichokes in season and I'm assuming they're probably harder to get at their Chicago location, but nonetheless the meal was simply delicious. I had their Margarita, spinach and artichoke dip, and went ahead and split a caesar salad, and BBQ ribs with a friend since the portions are so big. If i could eat a plate of the ribs and the coleslaw that comes with them for the rest of my life, I honestly would. What I've noticed with most of the salads and vegetables there is that they always taste exceptionally clean, light and never overdressed, The service is always great too, sometimes they get pretty busy, but I've never gotten frustrated with how they handle wait times and seating, since they are exceptionally good at making sure you aren't ignored or overlooked, and often seat you before their given wait time. Will be back!

I have been hearing about the macho salad here from my friends for almost a year and I finally had the opportunity to try it today. The initial bites were absolutely delicious, but I made the mistake of mixing the salad up which spread the vinegar that had been sitting on the bottom of the plate throughout the salad. It became a vinegar salad. There was just way too much in there. I'm still giving this place four stars because my companions enjoyed their plates and I think mine was the exception.  Definitely add extra grilled chicken to the salad.

A party of 6 of us stopped in without reservations after walking by the location of Michigan Avenue and checking out the Yelp reviews. It was too busy to seat is at the table but we ate at the bar.  Service was great, excellent staff. Our server was a young lady who moved to the city from Ohio to join a dance company and she also works here. She was warm, had a beautiful smile, and made wonderful food recommendations and kept our glasses full. My sister and I had the Macho salad and it was hands down one of the BEST salads ever with goat cheese, dates, fresh greens, almonds, corn, and more.... amaaaazing! My husband got the French dip and it was thin slices of prime rib piled high on crusty, buttery bread and served with aujis and horseradish.  The fries were hot and crispy. My nephew got the burger and he loved it too.  Overall excellent experience, a little pricey but worth it. The salad was $20 and the French dip was $22.
Excellent food, best roasted pork I have ever had. Wait staff absolutely superb, great team. Excellent atmosphere, great music. Reasonably priced, excellent value!

Anything you get here is going to be good. I have been coming here for years and it never disappoints the only reason I knocked off the star is because I feel habitually rushed here- I'm not at the Cheesecake Factory.  Ironically if you eat at the bar they rush you less.  Ambience is romantic with dim lighting and nightly jazz.  The Kale salad is one of my favorites, it's finely chopped with mint in a light buttery dressing that makes me crave salad! So good!  The lamb sandwich is to die for, I seriously have never had a sandwich as good as this - this is a must order if it's your first time in.  Their Margarita is better than their Moscow Mule - and I am a Moscow Mule drinker  If your a tuna fan their ahi poke salad and appetizer are delicious.  I've had their cornbread - I am not a fan, try the spinach artichoke dip instead. For dessert- order their homemade ice cream oreo cookie sandwich. They use a warm chocolate expresso topping which gives it sophistication and a perfect decadent pick me up after a meal.  This is my favorite Chicago restaurant, thank you for the amazing cuisine

We ordered the bbq salmon entree, today's fresh fish entree, and a cheeseburger with a side of hand-cut french fries. Both fish were cooked nicely and their respective side pairings were a good touch. The french fries portion was quite large. The only reason for the 4 stars is the lighting. It's pretty dark with candle light at the table. We sat near the window facing Michigan Ave and it was still pretty hard to see the food. I can understand wanting a romantic, ambient lighting, but this was a bit too dark. We also had the live jazz next to us, which was nice at times, but a bit hard to heard each other talk.

Came 2 years ago and remember loving the salad and happy to return on this trip to Chicago. Now I remember why I loved this salad so much (see my pic). So much flavor there's no need for cheese or meat. Veggie burger great too.  Might have to sneak back before I leave town. Great atmosphere, staff, menu, etc.

The ONLY place anyone on Michigan should be eating at. I've yet to have a bad experience here. However, I would suggest to make a reservation first as this place fills up at night. They have live jazz musicians playing, dim lighting, cozy seating, fantastic service, amazing drinks and the worlds best enchilada. You can't go wrong with Bandera it's definitely a hit every time!

Visited again and glad we did.  They updated the Kale salad and added rotisserie chicken.  It was a nice addition and the portion size was outstanding.  Everyone else had threee different fish entrees.  Salmon, whitefish and trout.  All of them were wonderful.  The mash potato accompaniment disappeared.  The live jazz continues to be a great touch.
I came here yesterday evening with my friend i haven't seen in awhile.  While my friend and i was catching up they never rushed us. I got the french dip sandwich it was soo good. Love the bread.

I have tons of dietary restrictions (no gluten, no dairy, no garlic, no onion, etc etc). It gets really complicated at restaurants and the staff here was nice enough to ask questions and be as conscientious as possible about what they were serving me. They even made sure I knew when they brought appetizers to the table that I couldn't eat. The service was great and even though there were two small mishaps with our order, they went above and beyond to rectify the situation and make sure we left happy. Would definitely come back! P.S. Couldn't try the cornbread for obvious reasons, but it looked and smelled AMAZING :)

incredible staff, food, and restaurant. They made the our eating experience so enjoyable and made sure we were happy with everything. The staff was very attentive to our party's medical restrictions and made sure every dish was made just perfectly. BBQ Salmon and every dish was delightful!
The best place in the area! Good food, drinks and the service. Nothing to add. The guys know their job. No lines! Not sure about parking though. Good alternative to The Purple Pig.

I really love this place. So many copycats out there but non of them do it like bandera. They have been consistently great for years and years. This is a go to when my wife and I are in Chicago. Be prepared for a long wait, but their bar is comfortable if you choose to dine there. I love their macho salad and the burger is my favorite. I have yet to try their famous fried chicken sandwich but I'm sure it's amazing like all the rest of their menu items.  Nothing bad to say.. I highly recommended it!

One of my favorite places in Chicago! It's a great spot, right in the middle of Michigan Avenue. The burgers are so good! The bun is perfect and the meat is super flavorful.  The duo dip - half cheese dip and half guacamole dip, is a must try. Trust me, the cheese dip is addicting. And you will want more.  The bistro salad is so good, and might be my favorite salad ever! Between the rotisserie chicken, goat cheese, almonds and dates, you can't go wrong. I recommend splitting this salad and a burger with another person. That way, you get the best of both worlds.  During our last visit, we noticed many of the guests were ordering their famous cornbread dish. So we decided to try it too. While the cornbread smelled amazing, there was really no flavor at all; and actually pretty disappointing. Besides that, anything else I have ever tried has been delicious.  The service is stellar and super friendly. One more tip - order their signature margarita!

I've been here a few times. I had the chicken. It's cooked on an open fire pit. So delicious! They also serve the best beef ribs. They literally fall right off of the bone! They are very clean and you can tell they use the freshest ingredients. I usually go here on special occasions. It is a  bit over priced.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I love their beef ribs. It's made perfect so juicy and succulent it just melts in your mouth. The staff there is so friendly. Every time I walk in there the friendly hostess always sits me by the window looking over Michigan Avenue. It's such a beautiful atmosphere I love piano and violin playing in the background.

Me and my family went for dinner on a Saturday night,  I had the tuna salad which was excellent. The tuna was cooked to perfection. The sales was one the best I have ever had.  My daughter had a veggie burger. It also was the best veggie burger.  The service was exceptional very attentive couldn't ask for any better.
Food was great. The grilled artichoke was the best I ever had. Highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago. Cheeseburger and cucumber salad was good too.
Very good grilled artichoke and dip; and amazing cheese burger. Cucumber salad is a very nice Mediterranean salad. Excellent attitude by servers at the bar.

We go to this place all the time with clients because it is convenient. Unfortunately they continue to disappoint us. The staff is rude, the service is poor and now we are seeing they appear to be reducing the quality of the ingredients. Sad to see on all fronts!

A bit old school, but they're not trying to be anything else. Had a burger (delicious), and a caesar salad done right. Went on my own while on business and sat at the bar. the place was rammed. Live jazz

We had a reservation for a Friday night. We were seated at the window overlooking Michigan Ave and across from the jazz trio. The view was great and although I was worried the music would be too loud, we had no trouble maintaining conversation. We ordered the cornbread because I had read so much about it in the reviews; it came out almost immediately and definitely met expectations. For dinner we ordered the pork filet and the macho salad. The pork was a nice thick filet, perfectly cooked and juicy with a slightly sweet sauce that rounded out the dish. The salad had plenty of the rotisserie chicken and a good ratio of toppings. We were too full for dessert, so I finished with an after dinner gin and tonic instead, (it was Friday night). Service was professional and friendly from the minute we arrived and throughout the entire meal with an attention to detail that is the difference between good and great service. I would recommend Bandera to anyone looking a relaxing dinner in a great atmosphere.

The ambiance is very nice. Intimate, really nice for a date night or a nice evening out with friends and family. Nice jazz music playing while you dine in. The food is good and big portions. So u get your money's worth.

Had a great time.  Was in town just for the night alone. Ate at bar.  Great service, well made Manhattan (important as many places do not) food was execelent.  Try the in season grilled artichoke.    Live jazz on Friday nights

We went here for the first time to celebrate my sons graduation.  We sat at a table overlooking Michigan ave.   The ambience of the restaurant is nice, though the Jazz ensemble playing could cause conversation to be difficult - sometimes it was really a little too loud.  The service and food were great however. The salmon appetizer was so good!! The lamb sandwich excellent!!  The fish dish was also excellent!!   Would definitely go back!!

My friends and I made reservations for a Friday evening. When we arrived there was a line of people waiting to be seated, but we were immediately seated. I strongly recommend making reservations! The ambience is romantic with dim lighting and live jazz band. The service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious! I will definitely be returning again soon.

Most definitely worth it! Just went there for a quick bite, unaccompanied, and rather than waiting in line a long time, I chose to sit and eat at the bar. The iron skillet cornbread is an absolute must and goes well with just about everything. In addition, I had a seared ahi tuna salad which was exactly what I needed ..., and it looked and tasted great. Expeditious service and some music background add to create a great ambiance. I would go again, even for more formal sit-down dinner.

This is the Chicago version of the restaurant we normally go to in Corona del mar California.  Service was good during their peak hour.  The GG Martini was very good- only 1 blue cheese olive was a minor disappointment. Smoked salmon appetizer was very good - similar to CDM.  Tried the pork filet entree - not offered in CDM - excellent! Mashed potatoes heavy, probably lots of unhealthy butter,  but good.

I came here for a family dinner for about 10 people. We made reservations, but did still have to wait a little bit, as it was a Friday night. We ordered drinks at the bar, and then were seated within about 10-15 minutes. There was a live band playing, and we were placed right by them, so it was great! When yelping, the cornbread kept coming up, so I had to try it-and I agree! The cornbread is a MUST try.  We all got either fish, chicken, or steak, and all came out in a timely manner. Everything was SO good, and our waiter was very attentive to us.  Would definitely recommend for any type of event!
Good food and music. We tried the French Dip , Corn Bread and Veggie Sandwich. The Veggie burger was the best of the three.

Always guarenteed an excellent meal here! Love this place. They take reservations and I was able to grab a same-day rez no problem.  I started off with a martini bc it's been a VERY long day at McCormick Convention Center. The Bee's Knees martini was fantastic. I got the cornbread that seems to be all the rave, and quite honestly it was just OK. I would give this a miss next time. I thought it was dry and didn't really taste like anything. I have had excellent jalapeño cornbread before, full of flavor, so I know it can be done. I ordered the Macho salad (minus the chicken) and this was just dynamite. If I could have this salad every single day, I would be a happy girl. Then I ordered the banana cream pie bc it had to be done and bc work was buying. I always stop by here when I am in Chicago!

Went here last night for our anniversary and had booked reservation 4 weeks early since only in town the one night. They were about 20 minutes behind seating is but offered a free appetizer of our choosing for the wait without us even asking! I had the macho salad and it was probably the best salad I've ever had. I don't love dates or goat cheese but this is the perfect pairing for it. My husband had the ribs with coleslaw and fries. Ribs were sweet and smokey both, while they melted off the bone. The only thing he didn't care for what how much mayonnaise was in coleslaw but that's all personal preference. I wish we had room for dessert but we had filled up on the cornbread appetizer already. Atmosphere is also perfect for a date night. Bravo Bandera for making our 10th wedding anniversary extra special.

This is one of me and the hubs favorite place to eat when we visit the "windy city." Yes, you need a reservation! I repeat, you need a reservation. It's well worth it. The atmosphere is great, the live music is wonderful and the food. Well, put it this way, I don't eat coleslaw  (I used to work at KFC & saw the way they made it and it turned me off from slaw). However, this coleslaw has me taking a box to go because it's just that good. Oh, and the quarter of baked chicken is AMAZING!!!!!  Our waitress was wonderful.

Okay so I was in the area with one of my girlfriends and we wanted a quick lunch before our spa date at the four seasons so I've always wanted to go to Bandera so we figured why not. It was a Sunday afternoon yet it was still jam packed. So definitely make reservations if you're coming during a popular time as it's right in the heart of Michigan Ave so things get quite busy over here. Unfortunately we were not there for their Jazz which they have in the evenings but I will have to try that next time. We started out with their tasty corn bread on a skillet and that's a must get over here, don't even debate that one second and just order it. It was a pretty big portion for us to share. We then each got the macho salad which was absolutely divine. I seriously think it's one of my favorite salads in Chicago now. Wish there was a bandera in the burbs as I always go to Wildfire for the chopped salad but I think I may have actually liked this one a tad more. We were super full from each having a salad as the portion was pretty large so we could have even shared and gotten a dessert. I really wanted to try their banana cream pie as it looked divine from a table next to us. We also had a seat by the window which was nice because it can get a little dark in the middle of the restaurant. Our server was super sweet and we had good service, so truly what's not to like. I think I will definitely frequent this place more when I come to Chi.

I absolutely love this place. The ambience abd the food is amazing. I love bringing family and friends here for dinner. My favorite desert is apple walnut cobbler. The ice cream with the warm apple pie is just amazing.

Bandera has long been my stop to host business lunches with out of town clients. Food is consistently delicious (go for the French prime rib sandwich) and service is excellent & very attentive. Great spot on Michigan Ave for good food, ambiance and service.

I've been here multiple times. Last visit I was very disappointed. Arrived about 3 PM and the place was dead. I found it as an opportunity for once to sit by the window. Considering every other time I sat at the be due to the wait. Hostess on April 15th gave us some excuse as to why we couldn't. Honestly I do no recall what she said. After she told me no, it went in one ear and out the other. The service going forward was great. We ordered the tuna salad and the spinach artichoke to start with. Few hours later my fiancée and I had all the symptoms of food poisoning. I won't go into the details. Great job considering it was about $80 with tip for spinach artichoke and 2 salads. I will not return

Highly recommended!! Came in on Easter Sunday with the family after mass and couldn't be more pleased with our experience! Food, service and ambiance were all 10/10 (live music, sadly, however, does not start till dinner). Started with the Spinach Dip which should not be missed. Menu is small but has a little something for everyone - ask your server for recommendations as the service is some of the best we've had in Chicago! Thank you to Desiree for making our day out very special!

I have been a fan of Bandera's for years and went here for dinner on my most recent CHI visit. Bandera always has good food, great service, awesome drinks and they aren't stingy with pours. You can't go wrong with a Bandera visit.  Some of my favorites - the artichoke, the sauce makes it. Macho date salad. Prime rib sandwich. Burger. Rotisserie chicken. Ribs you can cut with a fork.

Bandera is a hidden gem in Chicago. Friends recommended it, and it immediately became one of our favorite restaurants. The atmosphere is great, the view of Michigan Avenue is beautiful and the food is excellent. The signature cornbread is a must. Be sure to ask for butter to go with it. The salmon is also a must. If you just want to settle for a burger, you can't go wrong. Hint: Be sure to ask for a window table AWAY from the jazz band. Our last visit, we were seated right in front of the band, and we couldn't hear ourselves speak. A table by the window is recommended, but stay away from the band.

Cannot say how much i appreciate the service here. They (specifically our waiter Julian) made sure that all the dishes were altered to be dairy and gluten free according to my allergies. Usually this is not an easy feat at a restaurant but perhaps because everything is so freshly prepared here, they were able to. Food was impeccable, specifically had the ahi tuna salad, brussel sprouts, and ribs. Brussel sprouts were perfectly cooked, and my friend who normally does not like them loved it! A+ service A+ food A+ music, even when it wasnt live (live band starts around 5)

We've been to this location about 4x now and have had great experiences here every time. The service, the food, the cocktails, are all always deserving of 5 stars which is what you can come to expect from the Hillstone Restaurant Group. Glad that their only location in the midwest is conveniently located in the heart of Chicago!!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I always have a good experience here, and it has become my go-to place for a delicious and pleasant dinner in a central location. I'm a little sad they're no longer on OpenTable, but reservation is still quick and easy. FOOD is consistently good (recommend the ahi tuna salad and the current codfish and shrimp special), and portions are medium to large. Sometimes an appetizer dish is just enough to fill me up (gotta leave room for drinks and dessert!). SERVICE is more professional/formal than personable/casual, but fits well with the ambiance of the restaurant. All staff I've interacted with were courteous and pleasant. At peak hours they can become a little inattentive, e.g. neglecting our water glasses. AMBIANCE is suitable for romantic, business or special occasion dinners. It's on the noisier (not raucous) side, as they have live jazz every night and it's amazing. The music can be a little loud if you're sitting right next to the artists, but honestly it's my favorite part of dining here. Might not work for you if you're going for a more intimate romantic dinner experience.

This place is incredible. I am a vegetarian and their veggie burger was not only the most delicious veggie burger I've ever had, it was a work of art. Then on top of the incredible food was incredible music and atmosphere! I am just visiting Chicago but I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Nice place, long waits, and a little noisy which made it difficult to hear the guitarist and pianist work their way through the Real Book...yes, the music a great, laid backed jazz. Play the head, improvise, then close with the head. Drinks were nice but the Crisp Martini was too sweet for my taste...maybe cut back on the St. Germaine. The Old Fashioned was good. My wife and I shared the roasted Brussels Sprouts with lemon and garlic aioli. Excellent! We also shared a Macho salad that was very good but nothing to write home about.

I loved the atmosphere and vibe of this wonderful restaurant.  I was dining with 5 of my friends after a long stay at the hospital with my son.  The waiter Jim W was amazing, he was so compassionate after hearing my family story.  He was excellent, very attentive and ensuring we had everything we wanted and needed. The food was phenomenal and the margaritas were made to perfection.  I highly recommend this restaurant they have a pay it forward mentality, and everyone of the staff, managers  and owners really care about their customers.  I will be back soon to enjoy another wonderful meal and evening. All of us will be back. My new favorite Chicago restaurant.
One of our favorite places! Never disappoints. Must try the Macho Salad and Corn bread!
Best place for dinner in Chicago! We happened to just walk past it and went in for dinner. The live jazz music was so nice!

Was there for drinks and appetizers, the "Mean Team" was there and they were amazing bartenders! Three classy women who were  friendly and knowledgeable but takes no "prisoners"! Wish I was sober enough to remember their names! Great experience!! Love you "Mean Team"!!!

Geez, be sure to go for jazz as well as the food. Rotisserie chicken served with tabbouleh was as tender a chicken as I have ever eaten. Cornbread and smoked salmon appetizers were so delicious and the salmon is worth a trip back. BBQ salmon was okay but not exceptional and I always wonder why would you put BBQ sauce on such tasty fish? Macho salad with roasted chicken, avocado, dates, goat cheese and almonds was filling and tasty.  Add to that some good wine and the meal was almost perfect!  Kudos to our great waitress (Carolyn) and solid chefs!

Great ambience and food. I came here a while back and got the iron skillet cornbread as the appetizer, and the Seattle style BBQ salmon for my meal. The cornbread was okay (wouldn't order again) but the salmon... sooo soooo sooo good! The char gave it so much flavor, and it paired well with the mashed potatoes and broccoli. For dessert I got the Oreo cream sandwich which was fantastic too!

Had a late Sunday lunch at Bandera and had no problem being seated right away. Two of us split the prime rib sandwich and fries and couldn't have eaten a whole one!  It was absolutely delicious!  Best I've ever had! Just lots of thick, tender, flavorful, tasty meat on great tasting bread with some mayo and au jus. I'm already craving another even though it's a $19.00 sandwich. Worth every penny!  Wish the fries had been a little hotter and less greasy but they were still very good.  The cheeseburger was huge and cut in three pieces and my granddaughter said it was very good. Definitely worth the extra walking we did to backtrack to Bandera.  Note: 5 days later and the prime rib sandwich at Bandera is the best thing I have eaten on our trip to Chicago and we've eaten every meal out.  Wednesday night around 6:30 we tried to get in again but there was a 45 minute wait. Would suggest a reservation.

Great atmosphere. We ate at the bar and had grate service. Staff was helpful with the menu since it was our first time. I had dirty martinis that were perfect. I would recommend this place to anyone and would come back on my next visit.

I have been here a handful of times and gets better every time. I have come here for birthdays, date nights, family dinners, and dinner with friends. I have not always made reservations but if you plan to come on a Saturday night without a reservation expect to wait at least an hour. The hostess, bar tenders and waiters are all friendly and provide great service. Their food, I have had the salmon, mashed potatoes, chicken, dates, goat cheese, cornbread and avocado salad (my favorite), corn bread, artichokes, enchiladas, steak, brussel sprouts and broccoli. Everything is always amazing. Great portions and they will easily make substitutions if you don't like something or have an allergy. I don't like lemon but wanted the brussel sports and they made it with out the lemon aoli. I have gotten dessert a couple times and always go to the oreo sandwich. so good, so worth it!

Popped in to take a break from shopping and touristy stuff. The reviews online looked good so I thought I would give it a try. I arrived around 4pm on Saturday and was able to be seated quickly at a table. The bar was full otherwise I would have opted for a bar seat. I came during a shift change so I didn't meet my actual waitress until 15-20 mins after I ordered.  Service - the hostess was friendly and seated me quickly. The waitress that took my drink and food order was friendly and helpful about menu selections. The waitress that ended up being my actual waitress was nice but it was awkward since she came in after the fact (I think she may have been slightly late for her shift). The service was good overall but I felt that I was rushed out of the restaurant. I was trying to finish a glass of wine and ordered an espresso so I could sit a bit longer and finish my wine. The check was brought over with the espresso so I took that as a hint to leave. I moved over to the bar to finish my glass of wine (truth be told I'm a slow drinker).  Food - good. I ordered the French dip and it was tasty. My favorite part was probably the spicy mayo I dipped my fries in. The food was good but not great.  I think if I hadn't felt rushed by the staff so they could turn over the table I would have enjoyed my experience more.

What started out as a bit of a rough experience was fixed by the attentiveness and sincerity of management to the comments left on the back of the bill.  I have frequented Bandera often over the past 8-10 years and it is a consistently great experience (ergo the 5*).  The restaurant takes pride in preparing the food quickly and serving it hot.  On this night (a Friday), they were busy as usual, and service was a little too quick, with 3-4 dishes arriving one after the next, and dishes cleared / food boxed while i was still holding my cutlery.  I received a phone call from Amy within 15mins of leaving the restaurant and she offered a genuine apology for the service we received.  She seemed very sincere, and concerned that we had not enjoyed our evening.  This goes a long way with me - thank you Amy.

I came here specifically for the banana cream pie. We were seated at the bar, which fortunately has full kitchen service. However, when we looked at the menu, we were shocked to see only two desserts: the oreo ice cream sandwich and the apple cobbler! Fortunately, the bartender told us that they were featuring the banana cream pie that night, so even though it wasn't on the menu, we could order it. Phew, crisis averted. Now, let's talk about the bcp. Hands down, the best pie I have EVER eaten in my entire life. It was phenomenal. Creamy custard, fluffy homemade whipped cream, crunchy golden brown graham cracker crust, caramel drizzle over everything, and some sliced bananas on the side. Hoo boy. We ate every single crumb on the plate, and damn near licked it clean that pie was so good.  The only thing that caused me to subtract a star was the price: $11 for a piece of pie? That seems kinda greedy, Bandera. And the pie slice couldn't have been more than 1/6 of the full pie. But, service was excellent, and this may just be one of the quality over quantity places. One final plus of the place: they have a live jazz trio! We were seated close by, which made it fun and pain-free to wait for our dessert to come out. Great music, great food, can't go wrong.

Came to Bandera for an anniversary dinner while visiting Chicago. While I've been to there Newport location in California before, my boyfriend unknowingly booked a reservation at this restaurant because of the live jazz music. That alone makes this place a gem and shines above the Newport location. The atmosphere was great and we had a great table over looking the hustle and bustle bellow us and could look straight at the band. I mean can you rate on the atmosphere alone? We really wanted live jazz music. I mean, we were in Chicago.  Don't skip out out on the prime rib sandwich with the au jus sauce. It's definitely what other reviews rave about. We loved it so much that we decided to go again once we got back home. As much as I would have loved to order my favorite corn bread tonight wasn't the night to have it. But, so try it if you can. Our waitress was very nice and we had a great time talking to her about our trip. She made some great recommendations. But more importantly, her service was on point.

I took my friends here because last time I was there it was the best cornbread I had ever had. When we went on Saturday we went for apps and drinks and the cornbread came cold and the waitress dropped a big chunk on the floor and didn't offer to bring us a fresh one. Unfortunate as I had talked this place up previously.

I wanted to be cool and take my girlfriend out on a "nice" date.  After reading some reviews and descriptions about this place, I thought this was great. The best thing about this place was the atmosphere.  Great view (if you're sitting by the window) and great music!  They have a guitarist and pianist playing jazz all night long.   The food was OK but nothing "to die over" as some of the comments were saying.  Nothing special really...Although, the cornbread i thought was delicious!  We also ordered the oreo dessert which was pretty good.   The staff was nice...like, VERY NICE.  It got awkward at times.  I mean, not complaining about this, I'm Just saying it would be cool to tone down on the nice-ness a bit.   I think the only way I would come here again is for maybe some drinks with friends or girlfriend, but not so much for the food.
Never disappointed.Had lunch and dinner. Great service and the lamb sandwich will call me back. Not to mention the cornbread and duo dip. Treated very nice for two ladies out.

Would offer more stars. But when the young, inexperienced bartender brings my partner's drink before she finishes making my drink - not once but twice - and hasn't been trained to understand to deliver both drinks at the same time...then says "if I get you another stool (because there was only one stool available), will you have dinner with us?" I realize how little management cares about expertise and the assumptions they make about their audience. Could have been a favorite...

Although they mixed up our reservation tonight and we had to wait an extra 30 minutes to be seated I have to give credit where credit is due and they made things right.  They were very apologetic and I have to say I really appreciated their level of customer service once they realized a mistake had been made.  Once we were seated we received wonderful quick service and the food did not disappoint.  My sister had the petite filet which she said was one of the best she has ever had.  She gave me a bit to taste and I had to agree that it was so tender and prepared to perfection.  I had the Kale and Roasted Chicken salad which has quickly become one of my favorite items to order.  Everything we ordered tonight was delicious and even though there was the mixup with our reservation, they more than made up for it with the wonderful customer service and great food.  I would definitely recommend you try the food here.  There is a good reason why they have such a good rating on yelp.

We went here for dinner. I ordered the prime rib and cornbread and both are to die for.  The service and food was great, the bloody mary was just so-so.  I've had better with more ingredients. Great atmosphere and very relaxing and the waitstaff got us out to our flight right on time. Overall I would go back.  It definitely worth it.

I personally didn't enjoy this restaurant, the food lacked taste, and the drinks seemed a bit watered down. I went there to try the grilled artichokes out only to find out that they weren't in season, which I am not mad about, but still disappointing since nothing else appealed to me on the menu. However,  the environment was warm, the live jazz band was soothing, and if I were to ever come back, it'd be for that and that alone..

Bandera has become a personal favorite of mine - their service, food, and drinks, are always on point. The atmosphere of the restaurant is amazing - it's a great mix of calm, classy, and relaxing. One of my go-to meals here is definitely their 'House-Made Veggie Burger' but all the other items I have had on the dinner menu were fantastic too!

I went to Bandera with a couple friends last week, and was having a really off day. I ordered the cornbread as an appetizer, and the macho salad for my meal. When the cornbread came out, it looked fine, but upon putting it on the plate I saw the bottom was totally burnt. I was so frustrated, and flagged down the first person I saw. I spoke with Vinova, the manager, who immediately took away the burnt cornbread. Within minutes, she brought us perfectly cooked cornbread, and was genuinely apologetic about the situation. She took it off our bill, and even offered us a complimentary dessert for the trouble. The few times I have had to send something back at a restaurant, the servers always give me the impression that I am inconveniencing them- not with Vinova. She handled the situation so well that I already want to go back to Bandera, despite the burnt cornbread.

My favorite restaurant in the city of Chicago. The food is amazing. The service is outstanding and the drinks are superior. I love the beef ribs. I wish I lived closer. I would eat here everyday. The Paloma is the best drink on the planet. I highly recommend the beef ribs.

We hit this little hidden gem for V day the other day. Service is excellent (a little robotic) but very good overall. We started with a couple of cocktails, a Margarita and a kettle one straight up dirty martini. I was disappointed they only threw in 1 olive and it was a bit salty but hey! It was dirty allright. The Caesar salad with grilled chiken was delish and the chix soup just as tasty. Entrees are well proportioned and the entire ambiance is quite cozy. This place makes me want to drink until l get nice and toasted! (Lol) so cozy and dark. This place is good for first dates or a hideaway in the middle of the day. I love coming here.  Is just inviting.  (Our server) carlos? Was really nice and professional.

Best dinner we had in Chicago!  A prime rib sandwich wouldn't usually be something I'd order but after eyeing another customer's plate, I knew I had to try it. All I can say is, order the prime rib sandwich!! Husband had the filet and was impressed, as well. Everyone was very nice and eager to please. Bandera has a very romantic setting with live jazz playing and was the perfect selection for our early valentine's dinner.

Had lunch with coworkers here. The crispy chicken sandwich was great!!! Maybe a little too much slaw but easy to just pick off. The dip duo was also great. Had a nice view of Michigan Ave. Probably about 100$ for four people to eat so not the cheapest place but definitely good if you want to do a little something different. Want to come back and check out their HH with live jazz.
Best restaurant in Chicago! There ribs and chicken were sssooo good! Nice ambiance and great service! Love the jazz music! I'll be back!

Last night I had the lovely chance to eat dinner with an old classmate at Bandera. It's been almost two years since I last visited and I can say that Bandera is still amazing. Our waitress for the evening was training, I forgot her name but she did a wonderful job of helping us. We started off with a recommended brussel sprout as appetizer. I had a glass of riesling, and their NY strip steak, and my friend had their prime filet. We finished the dinner off with an oreo ice cream sandwich and banana cream pie for dessert. Everything was delicious! The live music really brightens the place up and the ambiance of the place makes you want to stay forever.  If you were to visit, definitely try the chef's daily specials! We enjoyed all the recommendations. I am so glad that I revisited Bandera again!
Love love this place. 2 nd time here. The steak is really big. If you have a big appetite, you should come here.

We came in around 12 pm on Monday without reservation, and it just took us 10 min for waiting. The service is excellent and the food is delicious. I love the atmosphere with jazz music playing and people are quiet talking during mealtime. We were so full ordering smoke salmon and salad as starters and BBQ Ribs to share. The food came out fast and large portions, and price is reasonable.  I would recommend to my friends and would love to come back in the future.

BANDERA. O how we love you. I think I've had most things on the menu. Everything is excellent. Service is excellent. And the ambience can't be beat. The live jazz is awesome. It's classy without feeling stuffy. Great date spot.

Wanted something a bit upscale but chill after a night at Chicago's SAG Awards party (Rockit hosted) and agreed on this. Great choice.  Not crowded on a Sunday night and a good view of Michigan Ave. Priced well (got apps and a bottle of wine), had great service from Michelle and an all-around good experience.

I love the place! The environment is so good, we ordered the tortilla chips and three dips, duck with barley salad and tuna. We also ordered one beer and one cocktail. Everything tastes amazing. Plus the jazz music is so good. I would like to go again to try other dishes!

Cool atmosphere. Drinks were pretty good. The food itself was just alright, nothing very great. I will say, the steak was very good. But, everything else was not good. Definitely not worth the price for this kind of place. There a ton of restaurants in this area with much better food and at a better price. Overall, it was just fine. I won't be going back though.
I had a great meal with a work peer and we had a great meal. I got the fish, it was excellent and tasted very fresh. I also tried the corn bread and that was great too.

Lovely spot for a date - I love the live music and dim lighting and the tables are spacious for a party of two.   Tried the artichoke dip, good, but a little bland, and the filet and enchilada combo - definitely recommend this dish!  The bartenders are good, I asked for a cucumber martini (not on the menu) and I got a great drink with muddled cucumber they asked for from the kitchen.  Very accommodating. The bar is nice to grab a drink beforehand but it does get a bit crowded so be prepared to stand and enjoy the music.

We needed to change our plans due to Second City tickets and walked in to this place with no reservations. Were told there was an hour wait, but the bar had full service. We waited just a few minutes and found two people leaving. Service was very attentive and there was a nice selection of beer and wines available. The jazz group was located just off the bar area and was playing a great version of Life On Mars while we were first sitting down. Food was delish. I had the lamb sandwich while my date had the bbq salmon. Food came out very quickly and presentation was superb. While I was a little bummed we weren't able to get in at my first choice down the street, I was pleasantly surprised and very happy with the service, food and ambiance of Bandera. Would definitely go back.

Hands down the best restaurant in Chicago! It's my place of choice if I have to celebrate anything...The beef ribs and the Caesar salad with that corn bread, you have to try it!! And the croutons, they're chopped up corn bread!! WHAT!?
Love the ambience. Corn bread is to die for. Great food and great service. Try for a window seat.

We walked in and were greeted with great ambience--warmth, dim lighting, and live jazz. It was a full house--packed!  We weren't sat until twenty minutes after our reservation. When our table was ready, we were brought to a booth next to the bar. I was hoping to be sat near the windows, but the booth ended up being pretty nice. The host was extremely apologetic for making us wait, and offered us an appetizer on the house to compensate. We ordered their famous cornbread, the Pine Room Salad, prime rib, and a special of the night, cod with crispy cajun shrimp. The cornbread was tasty. It's quite a bit of cornbread--too much for only two people, but the perfect amount for four. The salad was delicious!! Shredded greens, chopped egg, and an incredibly flavorful vinaigrette. It was a great choice. The prime rib was HUGE. It was a thick cut of meat, and it was bone in. The cod was good, but was overpriced for the small portion. You should definitely consider splurging on a bottle of wine. The wine list isn't very extensive, but they have a selection of great producers and beautiful wines at extremely cheap prices. I couldn't believe how affordable the prices were. We went with The Prisoner, a red blend I've been dying to try. At that price, it was literally a steal. It ended up being one of the nicest wines I've ever drank. I highly recommend. Our server, Rhianna, was incredibly sweet and kind.

Super fun great food. The ambience was live jazz band nice start dining room the really cool feel for the restaurant. We got pork tenderloin, I got beef ribs and half chicken. The ribs were awesome the chicken was OK. Started with the spinach dip and if you know anything about Hillstone restaurants that is a must to get. Think this would've been a 5 if the chicken part to my dinner was good. But overall it's a must go when in Chicago.
Ate at the bar, great service, excellent drinks, food was perfect. Nice ambiance. I would go again!

I personally  had a wonderful  experience  here. The service  was excellent and the food was Devine! The Manager was very friendly to me and made the experience even more pleasant.  I will definitely  be  going  back soon!

In town for Hamilton and celebrating my daughters birthday and several Chicagoans had recommended Bandera. We had an amazing lunch and a table with a nice view of Michigan Avenue! Service was wonderful. The cornbread is a must and our steak was incredible. Cooked a perfect medium rare. Really need to come back at night on our next visit and hear the jazz.

Service was a little dry and too serious but hey it could be worse. Lol. The food was good nothing phenomenal but it was good. The jazz band was great and the ambience is VERY nice. I'd go back for the ambience and drinks but that's about it

This place is one of the best steak restaurants I have tried in Chicago. Comparing this place to Jeff Ruby's of Cincinnati is easy. Every time I come to Chicago I stop here for a nice perfectly cooked steak. The Brussel sprout salad was excellent and I am not a huge fan of them. Their Oreo desert was also great. Definitely stopping back when I'm in Chicago again!
After a day of shopping at Nordstorms, my family always come here for lunch at Bandera. The roast beef sandwich is to die for here. It satisfy my hunger for roast beef.

Expensive and, not really tasty. I liked the view, but for the location I'm sure there are nicer restaurants out there. I hesitated to give it a three because there was a nice band playing, but I'm here to grade the food, not the atmosphere.

The worst customer service, especially the front desk, they tell you the waiting time 1 hour, you expect to wait 2 or more hours even you can see many empty tables. The most annoying part is the small pieces of paper which they use to organize tables and reservation. The one star is for the location and food. I will never go back again.

Bandera is one of those restaurants a Chicagoan patronizes mostly when visitors are in town. With a bit of a perch view across from Nordies it's perfect for the fam when shopping. And you know what?  The food ain't bad. In fact it's pretty tasty, generously portioned, and the service is always Midwest friendly and on point. I almost always order the Macho Salad which is chock full of deliciously tender pulled rotisserie chicken, fresh avocado chunks, and lots of chèvre. The fish sammie with the delectable peanut slaw is also a winner.

For christmas the hubby got me tickets to a show and reservations at Bandera! I was reluctant to go at first because past experience have been less than stellar but I am writing today to because everything was PHENOMENAL. Stopped in for an early dinner after a bit of shopping on Miracle Mile (perfect location!) and had a table by the window (as we requested) I recommend a window table with a view of the street!  Our server (also a manager) Vimova was spectacular and really made our time great! Great conversation, great recommendations! Artichokes (my favorite item) were out of season unfortunately but my husband and I loved our kale salad on the house because they no longer had his favorite item. My burger was extremely filling and I had to take some of it home as the portions are HUGE.  Over all I would recommend Bandera to all! After yesterday I have no more reluctandencies! Thank you for the special start to a special day!

Bandera has amazing quality fare and extremely reasonable prices. The ambiance is very relaxing, servers are very attentive and knowledgeable. If you can land a table by the window over looking the avenue.
Are you kidding me?  If you haven't been shame on you. Amazing restaurant and it's a chain. Try the kale chicken salad and the ribs. Incredible.

The most delicious steak and kale salad. The salmon was fantastic, perfect.  The prices seem about right for the quality and quantity of the food. We really enjoyed the special cocktails that the bartender made for us.  We liked everything about the place.  The atmosphere is elegant and fun, with a jazzy vibe.  We really appreciated that everything was spotless and well organized.  The manager. Rebecca, was very sweet. She made my son feel special since it was his birthday.   She was also very accommodating to my elderly Father.  She had such patience with him and we really appreciated that.  All in all it was a fabulous dinner and we will be back soon!

We went to Bandera based on a recommendation. We didn't get many details so didn't know what to expect. The place is great! Upon entering there's an open grill with chunks of meats flame grilled. We ordered those and they were amazing: fell right off the bone and the BBQ sauce was awesome. Service was very nice and classy.  Great place, highly recommended. Not on the cheap side. It well worth the money.

On the magnificent mile, the entrance might be easily missed. The restaurant is on the second floor with a view of the magnificent mile just opposite to the Marriott. I came here for the beef ribs and they were well cooked. Not so many places offer beef ribs on their menus. Excellent service.

I have been going to Bandera's for years, when it was just a Tribune writer's hang out and not a tourist trap. Having said that, the upgrades they've made over the years, such as the live jazz music, have been a consistent draw. However, my husband (who as a Fairmont employee has thrown them business for years) and I only come here on special occasions because of the atmosphere (and occasionally delicious prime rib), and although those include our birthdays, as well as our anniversary, they have never once done anything special, even when the information was given in the reservation beforehand. There seems to be a real attitude problem for the most part, as if only the beautiful people should be eating here, which I highly doubt applies to all the tourists on the Magnificent Mile. There is not any sense of caring about customers, let alone the dismissive attitude when you try to engage any of the servers in any kind of conversation (even when it's about the history of their own restaurant). So, for the price, the inconvenience of taking a cab there, and the snobbish attitude, I'll be taking my business elsewhere.

We came in with a small group of people for a nice dinner with live jazz on a Saturday night in the city. I had reservations and we were seated immediately upon arrival.  The service was friendly and welcoming. We ordered a round of drinks and got straight to business on the food. We ordered the famous cornbread and the duo dip - which was "queso" and guac with tortilla chips. The queso was just a big scoop of cheese. The guac was okay, but certainly could live without. I loved the cornbread, but I really wish it came with a side of butter or something gooey to smother it with. Just personal preference.  For food we ordered the filet, veggie burgers, and the BBQ combo. I think the general consensus was the food was okay, but nothing amazing or great. I had the BBQ combo and I have to say, I wasn't blown away by my food at all.  Overall, great atmosphere and ambiance but average food.

Fantastic! Great food, fast service, just what we were looking for on a Tuesday before Thanksgiving in C.  The roast chicken and BBQ Chicken was excellent - why? Succulent beef AND Chicken with an incredible cole slaw whose sweetness matches the tartness of the BBQ and the roast chicken . Wow.

My family has been coming here two days before thanksgiving since I was a young teen. Tonight Collin helped us, and he was absolutely splendid. He was kind, helpful, really personable. By far the best server we've had at Bandera. Food is amazing, the cornbread and County Dutch chicken are my personal favorites. Good wine too :) Collin made the whole experience so nice. Thanks, Collin and Bandera!

My boyfriend and I came here last night, and it completely exceeded our expectations (which were already pretty high based on the Yelp reviews). Our server, Maria, was so charming and did an excellent job with recommending appetizers, and desserts. We very much appreciated the awesome service, as the last few times we've gone out somewhere on the nicer side, they haven't been as enjoyable. The experience was delightful. The cornbread which was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and house made Oreo ice cream sandwiches are must haves.
Food was ok yet it was too noisy to hear the music.  From our table, we didn't even there was a live performance !
Cool setting. Great service. Cornbread is very good, as are the salads. Pricey for what you get though
I  the roasted chicken and mashed potatoes. I have to eat here every time I'm in Chicago. I would definitely recommend placing a reservation, this place fills up quick. Order the skillet cornbread.

The food here is too heavy for my taste. But I can see why other people with a different palate would enjoy it, particularly with the live jazz/music.  My cousin and I came here for dinner tonight - ordered the cornbread as an app. It's delicious for sure, but in eating a few bites of the leftovers at home I realized how buttery and rich it was (and sweet!). Ick - again tasty, but extremely heavy. It's a huge serving, so be prepared to have leftovers or share with a big group. For my main meal I ordered the whitefish, which came with french fries and a cucumber salad. I liked the cucumber salad, the white fish was okay but lacked a lot of flavor and seemed a little overcooked, and the fries were lackluster. If you're gonna put fries in your body they better be good, and these just were not. I say it's heavy because everything on the menu just seems heavy and grandiose. Even the platters our food came on were huge and took up half the table. I'm glad I tried Bandera, but wouldn't rush to come back. It's just not the type of food I can stomach on a regular basis. Some more pros - nice service, awesome that they have live music/jazz, and the location is convenient if you are in the downtown area.

Nightly live jazz band, great food and drinks! I love the ambiance here. It's sexy chic, meets upscale, bar and grill. Oh and Bandera with a view too! The restaurant overlooks beautiful Michigan Ave. They make fantastic cocktails and have a great wine list selection that never disappoints. I've been coming here for years and I've never had a bad experience. Service is exceptional. Best veggie burger I've ever and I mean EVER had! As well as the regular beef burger too, if Moo is your thing. The Emerald Kale Roasted Chicken Salad is to die for. My friends have ordered the Prime Rib French Dip and rave about it. I myself have never tried it but I'm going to have to trust them. They become so consumed stuffing their faces in this juicy sandwich that table conversations are impossible to have with them during their dining event. For appetizers the Spinach Artichoke Dip is a great choice and the Cornbread is a must. SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT.... Oreo cookie ice cream sandwiches!!! Umm Yessss please! You do NOT want to pass this up. You can later on pout about it and then hit the gym the rest of the week.

Love this place for a dinner with coworkers, clients, parents, or maybe even a cute date.  It's dimly lit, with jazz adding to the ambiance. Live jazz makes a big difference and allows for a very "Chicago" experience, so I would especially recommend this place for out of towners.  The drink menu was nice- classic cocktails and a decent wine list. The food menu was pretty simple- one page, with apps, salads, entrees, desserts, and a specialties section that included a couple of sandwich options. My party all chose from the entree list, or one of the entree specials our server told us about. The only thing that was a little off was the cornbread as a starter. It had bitter clumps in it- i think baking soda that hadn't been mixed in. My entree- a NY strip, was fantastic and cooked perfectly. The veggie sides were fresh and well seasoned.  I didn't have dessert, but they sounded fantastic! I would definitely come back.

Luckily, we made a reservation two weeks ago so we wouldn't wait in line while traveling here. Since I was new to town, I relied on Yelp a lot. At first, GPS of Yelp took me to somewhere close to this restaurant but I had hard time finding it. Finally, I called and they told me where they were on the second floor if I saw the sign, Men's Warehouse, on the first floor.  After checking in, I waited for additional 10-15 minutes to get seated. It was packed with people and the live Jazz music was on. It was a classy and elegant restaurant with dim lighting. I ordered mojito, grilled artichokes, Rotisserie chicken with a side of cucumber and a hand made Oreo ice cream sandwich. They did an excellent job on the appetizer. The artichokes were grilled perfectly with light sea salt and amazing dipping sauce. The chicken was juicy and moist and the salad was similar like Mediterranean style. To be honest, I was pretty full after the entree but I got to have a dessert for my birthday. It was amazing! I couldn't stop eating. Every bite of food was joy. Compliment to the chef.
