The server was helpful and attentive. They were really good at team work so kept my water filled and took away dirty dishes.  I highly recommend people to make a reservation before you come. I was very glad to find this place away from my home for my birthday.

Love this place! At first it seems a little commercial, but that goes away quickly.  Cocktails are handmade (great margarita that is not full of sugary mix).  Ask for a few blue cheese stuffed olives from the bar.  We always order the same thing, so I can't speak for the entire menu. We love the French dip and the ahi tuna salad.  This is a fun date or group spot, especially if you can get a seat looking out onto Michigan Avenue.  Sometimes the music can be a little loud.  We will be back!

The food is pretty good.  I had the cod special.  The fish seemed fresh and it was paired well with the shrimp topping.  This place is pretty romantic with the lighting and live music.  However, the service could be a lot better.  Multiple different wait staff kept on coming over confused what order was placed when we gave the appetizer order.  Also when asked for a box, the waitress started taking away half of the food that I had on one of the side dishes.  I asked for a box.  Things like that are a bit annoying.

I LOVE Bandera. We always make sure to make it one of our stops when we get to Chicago. Food is great, atmosphere is super cool, the service - eh. I usually come here with my husband and we have plenty to talk about, so I guess I never noticed that the staff is not very friendly. The food service is quick and efficient, but all you get are one word answers and minimal conversation. I was in town, traveling by myself and I sat at the bar. The veggie burger was incredible, best one around - so much flavor and a huge portion. The coleslaw was good, but not special. I wanted to get a piece of the famous cornbread, but I was told that they no longer serve it by the slice - only the whole skillet. I'm not sure what the rationale is for that?! I was not greeted by a hostess upon arrival - the bar staff was slow to acknowledge and take a drink order - my water glass was kept full, but I was never offered a second drink or dessert. I do not expect long conversations with the bartender, I know they are busy - but some personality would be nice. All of the servers were rushing around with no smiles - they looked super stressed. The Jazz was very pleasant and not too loud - it was still easy to have a conversation. I will be back for the incredible food and nice atmosphere, but the staff could use some training in hospitality.

Great atmosphere, good bartender, good food.  Only big negative was that the kitchen was VERY slow getting out the food.  30 minutes for two roast beef sandwiches.  Never seem an established restaurant so slow. Really great live jazz

Came here after a long work day to unwind and enjoy the jazz with good food. We got seated quickly without reservations and ended up right next to the band. I though it would have been more of a jazz club than a restaurant but it was definitely a restaurant with a jazz band squeezed into a corner. The menu was underwhelming with sandwiches and soups for dinner. We got the corn bread due to the rave reviews and got a couple of glasses of wine but ended up deciding to eat elsewhere due to the lack of variety on the menu. The corn bread was AWESOME, highly recommended it's crispy and cheesy and moist.

TIP: Make a reservation!!!   The atmosphere is so cool here...I lucked up and they just received the artichoke which were delicious, they've Been gone since April! For dinner I had the BBQ salmon, it was cooked to perfection.  By the time I sat down, I was so hungry I forgot to take a pix! They did offer a free appetizer for the long wait! That was nice!
One of my favorite restaurants downtown, great food and the best service hands down. If you check it out get the enchiladas but be sure to make reservations this place is always packed.

My husband and I love this place. We treat ourselves once a month or so. Their ribs are the best, very fresh and flavorful. I usually order their macho salad YUMMY! Drinks are good prices are reasonable considering location . The atmosphere is very relaxing and their dim lighting  is great! Love this place !

Their food is amazing. My favorite was definitely the Spinach Artichoke Dip, but the salad and enchiladas followed shortly after that. The service here was also exceptionally good. I will be coming here more often! I can't wait to try more entrees.
The macho salad here is the best! Full of flavor . So different that others. The best no doubt!!!!

Love the live music and all of our food was delicious.  Our group had the pork filet, cheeseburger, the french dip and we shared the oreo dessert. Service was fast and they do not skimp on their liquor.  Highly recommended!
Love this place. Stop burning the corn bread. That's one of the reasons people come here.  The food, atmosphere and service is excellent.

We were able to walk right in at 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday! Bandera is a swanky, dimly lit, sexy restaurant. Our table was close to the fabulous live jazz that is heard every night. Big comfy chairs at the table, lovely table settings and an extremely knowledgeable server. Everyone in our group of four had the luscious filet with a huge scoop of herbed mashed potatoes and a gigantic fresh salad. I opted for a glass of red wine and my man had a beer, natch. No dessert for us this night as we had to leave for an event. Plus, my pants were too tight!

Went to Bandera's with two of my childhood friends and our husbands. This was an important night for three friends who have known each other for over 40 years. We wanted it to be special... Well, Bandera's did not disappoint! The Jazz was playing and the lights were low when we came in. We were warmly greeted and soon thereafter shown to our table. And we had a great table near the musicians and the best waitress in the place - Naomi! Service was nice - really nice. Relaxed and not rushed. We began with the corn bread and drinks and oh my! If you've had the cornbread before you know what I mean. Talk about good!! The fish, the ribs and chicken combo (2 of the men ordered this), the ribs alone, the chicken alone and the prime rib. Our table runneth over and everything was fabulous. We had a great time. Lots of reminiscing and lots of laughing. Thank you to Bandera's - it was perfection!

This a must do restaurant in Chicago.  Make your reservation and get there on time.  This place is happening.  The jazz trio last night was excellent.   Our party enjoyed the Tuna Poke and the salmon appetizers. The salmon is smoked in house and was the best I have ever had.  Dinners included the special sirloin, the pork filet, and the Lake Superior white fish.  Each dinner was excellent.  I'll make Chicago my new vacation destination and include this restaurant.

Most friendly hillstone restaurant I have dined in. Food is always consistent. For some reason I think the fries are better at Houston's. Ribs are great along with the French dip. The macho salad is my wife's favorite. Awesome views of Michigan ave!

I have never been made to feel mortified by a restaurant experience until dining at the bar at Bandera tonight.  I've been to the Michigan Ave restaurant many times.  Tonight my friend and I were cutoff by the bartender after only a few drinks.  We had several appetizers and just a few drinks.  There was no reason at all for the bar tender to take this action.  I've never felt so embarrassed.  When I asked to speak to a manager, we were offered a free round of drinks.  Clearly, if they were going to give us free drinks, we were not over the limit.  Get it together Bandera.  I'll NEVER go back.  Awful experience to ruin many good ones.

My wife and I are in Chicago for a long weekend and ate here Saturday night. The meal was quite nice and the service was very good. There was a very nice jazz trio playing that night. We highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a nice atmosphere and a good meal.

Visiting Chicago for the first time. Called in for a reservation and was told 9:15 PM on the phone. We got there early and was told that our reservation was at 9:30 PM (different than what was said on the phone). That time passed and we were told that we would get the next table that seats 5. They saved a table for a party of 4. They did offer to split our party to separate tables. Ouch! They told us to wait a bit longer to clear a table a couple of times as the party on that table was sipping their wine, but we decided to bounce.

Great business dinner!  Not a loud place at all, even with live music, so we could have a relaxed conversation over very nice food.  An appetizer, two main courses from their pricier selections and soft drinks from under $80.  A really good deal for such a nice place.   Got there at about 5:30 on a Wednesday and we were seated at a window table which are probably their best tables.  By the time we left at 6:30 there were no window tables available. Would be great for a date too.

It was our first dinner place of our Chicago getaway. Nice pure American atmosphere with live jazz on a Thursday night. We went without reservation at about 9.30pm and had to wait 20 min.  The place was crowded, so was the bar.  I guess their corn bread is a signature dish for only $8. It is a whole pan and with an exquisite rich corn bread with a little bit of jalapeño (I do not like spicy food at all) this was not spicy at all.  As a tuna lover, I order tuna tartare everywhere, this place has an extremely 5 stars quality tuna poke, served with avocado, macadamia nut, mango and yummy sauce!!  Spinach and artichoke with cheese and chips. - you can make it bad!!  Finally, famous FRENCH dip a jus, this is a 5 star jus that can make any dish fabulous ! The quality of meat was awesome , check the pinkish color on the picture ! Enjoy Chicago! We came back for another dinner and did not regret at all. This time it was entirely a meat base dinner and I have to tell you that it was an awesome dinner experience with live music included.  We even complimented the waiter and said that the prime rib was better than at the Breakers in FL, but he did not know what restaurant was that.  Anyways, enjoy the music, meat, corn bread and Chicago!

Had high expectations, one of the worst services ever, which is a let down being Chicago has so many amazing restaurants. Called and made a reservation for moms birthday and decided to go with this restaurant since reviews were amazing, food looked amazing and they had live jazz. They definitely were off their A game this night.  Called and had reservations at 730, told them it was a special tonight as we were celebrating a big birthday. Seated right away which was good, host was not that welcoming, had to reassure them we were celebrating a birthday just to make sure the night went well.  Once seated, things just didn't seem to get better. The waiter was young and didn't look like he liked this job - you're a waiter - smile a little. We ordered drinks that came out sporadically. The cocktails we ordered came out first but what made me upset is when granny ordered orange juice. It came out almost 15 minutes later then when she tried it, it was so sour and full of pulp. We had to order her something else and when we told John, the waiter that never smiles, he said that's how OJ taste then walked away. That makes sense why he's so sour if he thinks orange juice is supposed to taste sour.  Overall the food was amazing. I can't complain with the chef as everyone really did enjoy the food. We had the pork, chicken and ribs, all very flavorful.  When we were about finished with our entree - "about finished" - the unhappy waiter came over and prematurely took our plates away without even asking if we were done. I was still munching on my damn fries John.  When my fiancé ASKED for the dessert menu, he didn't give us one, instead told us. Fine. Then we asked to order the apple a la mode, server looked surprised we were ordering dessert. That's when I just had to ask him did he know that we were celebrating moms birthday, hence why we want dessert for her special day. He said he didn't know, where the heck is the communication with the host and server. Even though the meal was delicious - there are so many places in Chicago that has amazing food. Family celebrations should not be experienced with service like this. Get it together.

They said there was live jazz for when we went , but it appeared that there was none whatsoever when we were there. Other than that, decent but overpriced food but probably decently priced for its location on Michigan ave. great date spot with dim lighting and a great, intimate atmosphere. Food was just ok to me.

This obscure restaurant right on Michigan near the Men's Warehouse Store is a gem. It is almost as if you have to be a Chicagoan or someone in the "know" to find it given the low key signage. Inside there are plenty of window seats overlooking Michigan Ave. or plenty of cozy booths. Our table ordered their salads to share and we were not disappointed. Their macho salad was delicious as was their seared tuna. We also got an order of their hot corn bread. It was good but probably not great for the waist line!  Service was impeccable. I love knowing this place exists and one evening plan to stop by for a jazz performance too. 5 Stars for a prime location, lunch food and service.

Jazz musicians were very good. White plank fish with mashed potatoes and broccoli were fabulous. Wine selection was good. Corn bread was good, but nothing special and extremely hearty for an appetizer. Service was good. Wish there were more menu options.
Very nice ambiance, good food, great view of Michigan Ave and good band.

The right place for family dinner or a date. The atmosphere is charming, dimmed lights, live jazz (they do even modern songs in jazz). Staff is nice and helpful. Now to the main point - food and drinks. Cocktails are awesome - mules and margaritas especially! Goat cheese salad is a perfect choice and don't forget to get dessert - the apple crumble, food-gasm!

Excellent food, music and people/watching!  The wine selection was first-class.  The menu had so many great choices.  The appetizers, steaks, fish and the deserts were outstanding!  The energy here is amazing!  I hope to return soon.  Do not miss this place!

why the change of heart you ask??!! After my initial review in which I stated the service was great, well I have to say it extends to the management as well. I was contacted by Michael (manager I suppose) I'm sure he identified himself I just can't remember:(, he was concerned about the review and after speaking with him I have to say that next time I'm in Chicago I will give Bandera a second chance! Thanks Michael for the exceptional customer service!!
Just had lunch an amazing Machu Salad with freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. Amazing!! I will definitely be back. Cute place reminds me of an upscale pub. Great place for a date. Service was good.

Bandera surprised me. I thought it would be a touristy, bland menu. And, honestly, the menu didn't impress at first sight. But the space itself did - an intimate, elegant venue with great service that didn't care I was in jeans. The jazz pianist actually played a great variety of live music, which we had a lot of fun listening to. We stated out with the artichoke dip. Honestly, I've never had this sort of thing before and it didn't wow me. It became much improved by adding the provided salsa for a bit of kick, but I'm not sure I would order it again.  The macho salad, on the other hand, completely wowed me. A delicious mix of chicken, goat cheese, corn bread, veggies... I would eat that for lunch every day if I could. And such a big portion I couldn't even finish it!   The lamb sandwich was much improved by the jus. It was good, but not worth coming back for. Overall, a good option for the mid-range downtown dining scene. I'd go back for the salad and music if I was hunting for an option in the area.

The food. The atmosphere is perfect.  They play live music after 5pm. If you are planning a date or a special occasion, know when the band plays is important.  You can see the kitchen from anywhere in the restaurant. It is fabulous.  The service is great although waiters can more a little slow. But it's good if your not rushing. I go whenever I can.

Moving from San Francisco we thought we had left one out favorite restaurants behind. That was not the case 'Houstons' as this restaurant is known in SF is known in Chicago as Bandera. They carried most of our favorites as well. The grilled artichoke is a great starter and the French dip is my choice of appetizer at Bandera. I just wish they had the steak Thai noodles and ahi mango tuna salad from the SF location.

Classy! I had an exceptionally good dining experience at this restaurant. Smooth jazz played softly in the background as I made my food selection. The lighting was dim and the ambiance was very romantic. The service was stellar. I found the waiters to be very attentive and open to providing recommendations that help you choose a dish to your liking. I had the aged & season prime ribs with asparagus. Heaven on earth! I found the meat to be extremely tender and appropriately cooked (medium). I also had drinks at the bar while waiting for a seat. I plan to visit again, asap. Lastly, I would strongly suggest that you make a reservation. I waited for about 30 minutes to be seated and I got lucky due to a cancelled reservation.

I made our reservation online through the app offered through Yelp the day before we went.  On the day of the reservation I called Bandera and shared that it was a special occasion: my wife and I were celebrating our 14th wedding anniversary.  Upon arrival I didn't expect us to be led by the host to a window view near the Jazz players. Our waitress was the friendly Carolyne who then offered us a bottle of champagne to celebrate the evening.   That's how it began and boy were we about to begin our tastebuds journey with the house-smoked salmon and grilled artichokes to begin our feast.   Both my wife and I ordered the aged and seasoned prime rib that was enriched with chives and parsley mash-potato and pesto broccoli.  The deliciousness was complimented by bringing Spain to us with a bottle of Muga reserva wine.   Carolyne was such a nice waitress who balanced her attentiveness with friendly conversation and deserved the 30% tip we added to the bill.   Coffee and the apple cobbler tastefully ended our meal while the Jazz music continued as we walked out a happy couple.

Phenomenal service and great food! The French dip roast beef is the best one I have ever had anywhere. I also had Stella Artois on draft which was absolutely delicious as well. The veggie burger takes a new twist with their soy type of sauce and fresh pickles, lettuce, and tomato. Definitely recommend! Great atmosphere too.

We went here looking for a nicer dinner. The service was very good. The food was  alright. I felt our appetizer, Spinach and Artichoke dip was no better than other places and about twice the price. The macho salad and the fish my husband got were both "fine" - nothing really excellent. The atmosphere was really nice with the live Jazz band. Maybe we just ordered the wrong items, but I didn't necessarily feel that we'd go back and pay over $100 for this food.

This is one of my favorite Chicago restaurants. It's not terribly fancy but a very well run co side fly high standard food quality restaurant.  The wait staff are understated therefore not overbearing.

One of my favorite restaurants downtown. The atmosphere, food and service worth every cent we paid for. Live jazz happens daily starting from 6 pm. The cornbread is great, bbq ribs are fantastic, we also had the fresh catch of the day, also delicious.

This place was awesome. Right on the Magnificent Mile, a cool entrance to the restaurant, and very nice inside. Had great live Blues Music which created a nice atmosphere. The wine, food and employees were all great! I would definitely go back! The fish of the day was a Georgian Cod with Shrimp and it was delicious!

Great experience!  The cornbread is a must,  my Macho Salad was fantastic.  My wife's Ahi Tuna was great and our friends loved their grilled salmon and ribs.  Funny thing is what they raved about was the Cole slaw!

Me and my girlfriend gave this restaurant a try just recently and I must say this restaurant is rather nice and more affordable then most upscale restaurants within the city of Chicago.  The atmosphere of the restaurant has more of an intimate type of feel to it. I don't remember seeing any children so that kinda implies that this place isn't really kid friendly.  They have live music and I believe they have different musical acts night. The musicians that played (pianist and a guitarist) when I had visited the restaurant played modern pop music (Taylor Swift) and old time favorites like Don't stop believing by -Journey with a jazzy like of twist to their music.  The food was great overall. We both ordered the bbq chicken and prime beef ribs. With mashed potatoes and spinach.  The bbq beef ribs were excellent. Cooked to perfection, crunchy to the first bite but still soft enough to be tender and chewy. The chicken was good as well. It was seasoned fairly well and the bbq sauce was a great touch that gave the chicken it's extra kick.  The mashed potatoes weren't the best. In all honesty the chef could have laid off a little on the chopped onions that were mixed in as well as the the chives.  The spinach was great as well.  Overall my experience at this restaurant was great. Our waiter did a phenomenal job and just about the employees that I could see had a positive countenance.  I'd recommend this restaurant for a nice dinner date.

We came all the way to visit Chicago and highly recommend to this restaurant, since they have good steaks one of our friends was wearing tank top bc the weather was very hot then they told him he's not allowed to get in and the hotel was far away. Btw, the server was so rude when she talked to him.

I was in Chicago for a work conference and met some friends for dinner. July is peak tourist season so the restaurants on Michigan Ave were packed with waiting times of at least 45 -60 minutes.  We saw the sign for Bandera which is located on the second floor at 535 N. Michigan Ave and thought let's see what this place is like.  I vaguely remember eating here probably 20 years ago when I lived in Chicago but couldn't recall what the food was like.  I was overwhelmed by the quality of the food and the outstanding service we received.  There was a wait of 30+ minutes so we waited in the bar where Christine was our bartender. The wine list was impressive as they carried some smaller CA vineyards not usually seen on the wine offerings of other mainstream places.  The atmosphere in this restaurant is pleasant and the noise level is such that we could actually have a conversation without shouting at each other.  Once we were seated, our server, Michelle, was top notch. Friendly and professional.  She recommended the corn bread for an appetizer and all I can say is YUM.  Hot, fresh, delicious. Right out of the oven.  For my main course, I had the macho salad which included fresh avocado as well as delicious roasted chicken.  Our experience at Bandera was a solid 5 stars.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

This is probably one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. We were lucky enough to get a seat facing Michigan Ave at night while the Christmas decorations for Chicago were still up. The ambience was absolutely incredible between having the view of Michigan Ave, the dim candlelit dinner, and the jazz musicians who were directly behind us. Even with the musicians being so close, we were still able to have a pleasant conversation without having to yell over the music. Every dish that we ordered was very well-done. We ordered the "house-smoked salmon" as an appetizer; the smoked flavor was definitely very rich and when the salmon was put on bread and covered with the spread provided, it melts in your mouth. We also ordered "today's very fresh fish" and the "rotisserie lamb sandwich." Both entrees were prepared and cooked very well and completed our wonderful experience. I loved absolutely everything about this place and apparently so does everyone else; if you plan on coming here, especially on a weekend, make a reservation. I am extremely impressed with this restaurant and if I find myself around Michigan Ave again any time soon, I will definitely be returning. Absolutely amazing.

I'm a huge Hillstone fan and this place did not disappoint.  My son and I had the lamb sandwich, beef ribs and chicken combo, the corn bread and Macho salad and each was better than the dish before.  Our waiter was also excellent.

Stopped into this restaurant for a Sunday lunch. Read the reviews and they were correct. Food was delicious and the ambiance is very nice. Reminds me of Houston's in Atlanta, probably because it is owned by the same company.

One of my all time favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Great food, reasonable prices, the only downfall is there is usually a wait and lots of tourists because of the location.  I always go for the Queso dip as an appetizer and the ribs are amazing!

We've eaten here the last few times we've visited Chicago. Again, the food and service was wonderful. Fresh fish - fantastic! The pork was so good! Fillet was on point. Of corse the corn bread - one of their specialties - was amazing. Crusty top and moist inside!! The atmosphere is great - a nice break from busy Michigan Avenue - live jazz trio is the perfect music.

One of my favorite date spots in Chicago. As a prior Los Angeles resident, I love the Hillstone concept that is available here in Chicago. Bandera (and all Hillstone restaurants) have incredibly consistent, high quality food. My boyfriend and I never leave unsatisfied. Highly recommend the skirt steak enchiladas and cornbread. Great margaritas, too.

Came here for lunch on a weekday and sat at the bar. I ordered the tuna poke and it was very good. Definitely a little formal for just sitting at the bar. The bartender kept trying to put a cloth on my bar top even tho I asked her not to. Good food though.

We came for a relatively late Sunday evening dinner.  The wait for a table was still 35-40 minutes, so instead, we sat at the bar and dined. Service was strange in that we had great, friendly service through a very attentive bartender through the main course.  Then she disappeared without explanation.  No one else filled the gap. We sat waiting for someone to ask for another drink, coffee or dessert.  Rather than beg to spend more money, we paid our bill and left.  Food was close to 4 star range.  Service started as a 5 star and dissolved to a one star.

We had great service and great food. Prime rib was prepared perfectly. I am happy that Hillstone continued to uphold the quality that I am used to!  Only negative -- music was a little loud and not a place that I would bring my grandparents! I will come back.

Best restaurant/bar in Chicago! The staff was awesome. Carolyn and Nicole know how to make a damn good margarita. They also told us where visit in the city. Had a great time. Would definitely recommended eating/drinking here

Good ambience and music,  the location is in the second floor on Michigan so it is expected the place is always with a crowd. Food is good, most dishes has a Mexican trend..  Tried their soups and chicken kale salad and both were good.
I always make sure to come here at least once when I'm in Chicago. Great bartenders and friendly staff, especially Carolyn and Nicole!

I am writing this, risking that this place will become too popular and I can't get in anymore. But I will come out and say it; whenever friends come in from out of town and want something on Michigan with great food and a great atmosphere, I take them here.  Service is great, drinks are top of the line (extensive bourbon and whiskey list!) and the prime rib dip sandwich. LORD, the prime rib dip sandwich. Not too heavy, tons of flavor, and cannot be duplicated within the environs of this great city. PLUS! A jazz trio sets up  shop and plays tunes, and they're not bad at it.  Now I want the sandwich. THEY TAKE RESERVATIONS!

The food was delicious. I had the Emerald Kale and Roasted Chicken Salad which was, hands-down, one of the best salads I've ever had. It was very interesting with peanuts to add texture, it was almost like eating a good Pad Tai (but entirely different)--It will confuse and delight your tongue and tastebuds. ;) The ambiance is definitely intimate. It's a dark and moody environment with the live soft jazz in the background--ABSOLUTELY perfect for date night...slightly awkward when you're single and have a table for one in front of the jazz band.  Definitely a TREAT YO SELF kind of dinner.

Note: This restaurant is not conducive and apparently not able/willing to seat groups of more than four.  Exceedingly disappointed. With clients in town for a two-day retreat, Bandera seemed like a great option (location, live music) for an early dinner. Upon making the reservation, we were informed that they don't have more than a six-top, but, could combine it with a two to make eight (which was fine - that happens at other restaurants all the time!)  When the group arrived, the eight had been arbitrarily split in half and were told they WOULDN'T EVEN BE SITTING NEAR EACH OTHER due to the size of the group and the fact that their tables are bolted to the ground. Not only was the staff's attitude bad and dismissive, but they then said that they would have told the person that made the reservation that this would happen. Needless to say, they walked out. Skip this and try MJs at the Intercontinental.

Went to this restaurant the first night we were in town because of the advertised live jazz. Wasn't disappointed! Unfortunately, the wait was 45 mins (not terrible on a Saturday night). Nevertheless, dinner was really good. The jazz was a nice backdrop, but got a little too loud at times, making conversation difficult. Portions are huge, so if you're thinking of getting something substantial as an entree and can't bring home leftovers, don't get an appetizer.  That's not to say that the black bean chicken chili wasn't fantastic. The strip steak special was equally amazing, a huge cut that sliced like butter. I substituted fries for the chive potatoes and spinach, which was a great choice. Overall, the atmosphere is nice, if a bit stifling at times, the portions are huge and delicious, and the service is good. Definitely worth the wait.
A good spot.  In the heart of Michigan Ave, always find myself coming back.  Never had a bad meal.

My husband and I just had an amazing dinner at Bandera. The location is up an escalator across from a Men's Warehouse, but don't let that fool you. The decor inside is dark and classy.  Our waitress was excellent and they kept refilling My husband's water. We sat next to A fantastic three-piece jazz band. It was really nice to hear them play! The first course we got was the cornbread. It has a little kick it with jalapeños, but was really warm and crispy on the outside. We then got the tortilla soup which was delicious. Our waitress even brought two spoons without us asking. I ordered the salad with tuna, which was fantastic. My husband got the salmon which was outstanding. I am not a fan of seven and I really enjoyed it. Even though we were completely stuffed, we managed to finish homemade Oreo ice cream surrounded by two Oreo disks. We then rolled back to our hotel. What a great meal!!

Ok...been going here for year's, but the latest plan to squeeze out another nickel in profit was just too much for me. Charging $3.50 for each refill when ordering an an ice tea sweetened with lemonade (Arnold Palmer) is the straw that broke this camels back. Good by.

Was invited to a dinner by my friend in Chicago. He said this was his favorite restaurant went on a Thursday night at 7 pm, was crowed. Service was excellent and we were seated right away. Food was good. The ahi, avocado, shrimp pok'e with chips was an interesting Chicago twist on Pok'e. We had the roast chicken, was tasty and moist. Jazz music was excellent. Great location on Michigan avenue we could walk there for dinner and jazz.

I went here with the wife and out of town guests.  This is an overpriced tourist trap on the Magnificent Mile that had okay food.  I don't recommend it as there are better options that are more reasonably priced.   The appetizers were okay, but obviously pre-prepared by Sysco or some other supplier.  For example, the spinach/artichoke dip is not as good as what I can get cheaper at Red Lobster.  The sandwiches were okay.  I had a Lamb sandwich that came with a weird dipping sauce that tasted like nothing.  The fries that came with it were a complete failure, undercooked and mostly tasteless.  The sandwich itself was fine.  The wife ordered the French dip and had the same problem that I did.  The dipping sauce was tasteless so the sandwich was essentially a pile of steak chunks. That would be okay at the corner deli, but these are not cheap sandwiches.   Service was good.  Overall this restaurant is barely passable, but should be a lot better than that based in the price. The drinks are also $2.00 more a piece than they should be.

This is a Hillstone Group Restaurant (e.g. Houston's), so going in, we knew it would be good. But our expectations were greatly exceeded.  The restaurant is on the second floor of an unassuming building...a hidden gem. The restaurant is lined with walls of windows allowing for a nice view of Michigan Avenue. On Friday night, there was a live band playing softly, which added to the ambience.  The service was phenomenal from the moment we walked in the door. Our waiter was EXCELLENT!  We started with the spinach and artichoke dip and the jalapeño cornbread. Both were delicious. For dinner, I had the filet which comes with Parmesan mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach. The steak was cooked to perfection! We ordered the apple cobbler for dessert and it was also excellent and served piping hot a la mode. I highly recommend it. Overall, it was a great experience from start to finish.
6/20/2016 - Hillstone restaurant group never fails. Bandera was outstanding! Amazing food, service, and wine. Music was also outstanding. Great view of Michigan avenue. Lovely date night, had it all.
This my favorite place for bbq ribs and unique salads. Really nice decor and dark place to fine dine. Always busy no matter the hour. Recommend any dinner date occasion

I really really wanted to like this place. I made a reservation a month in advance for my boyfriend's birthday, giving a special request that we would like to sit next to the window. We got there and they said to get a window seat it would be about 20 minutes, which we were fine just waiting. 30-40 minutes go by and they seat us in a booth that was not near the window at all. I am normally not this picky but I knew that there was a great view outside the window and I just wanted it to be special for his birthday, so I was a little disappointed when we had to wait so long to not even get a decent seat. As soon as we were seated, the jazz music stopped and didn't play once during our entire meal. Lastly, when our food finally came out, it was OK, but not great by any means and not worth the price.  Like I said I wanted to like this place but those series of events just led to a disappointing experience. I don't think I'll be returning.

Great atmosphere, great wait staff, great food. Wish we were hungrier to have ordered more! I got the salmon (minus potatoes were cold) and it was cooked perfectly. My colleagues got the mancha (?) salad and lamb sandwich and loved them!  Would definitely go back if I were to visit this city again.
Amanda s was our server.  She was  awesome.so  sweet and funny! Food was delicious. I had the fresh fish and shrimp with broccoli and it was so good
I think I've been coming here for 10 years and ordering the Macho Salad so please never take it off the menu!!!

Went here for a Saturday date and it was very crowded. We could not get reservations so were seated at the bar. The service was excellent and the food was incredible. We shared the cornbread skillet as an appetizer which was the best cornbread I have ever had. I got the salad with tuna, mango, and avocado and enjoyed every bite. It was the perfect portion of food. I also enjoyed the live jazz band

Really courteous and friendly staff.  The hostess even took our suitcases to storage.  Did the lunch menu.  The cornbread is moist and really flavorful. Taking some left overs for breakfast.  The kale salad was amazing, the peanuts add texture without over powering the dish, and the dressing is unique.  Really good.  The squash enchilada was also unique and tasty...well seasoned with the delicacy of the squash subtle flavor.   Would definitely come back.
Good food. Only ate here once. Right on Michigan Ave. nice place to take a break from shopping. I would suggest trying it. Wasn't one of my favorite places in Chicago.
Freaking AMAZING! Great food, great service. Everything we ordered from the drinks to the appetizers to the main was cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor. Don't question your decision to eat here.

It's really easy to make a reservation with them online. We got there about 5 minutes later than our reservations (we were on the wrong side of the street :/), and had to wait about 5 minutes to be seated, but our waitress was very friendly and helpful when we asked about different dishes.  I ended up getting the French Dip which seriously has the most amazing slices of beef.  It's a good meal if you haven't eaten all day like I had on that day.  For dessert I had the Oreo cookie ice cream which was so good.  I definitely recommend trying it.

Outstanding! Our server Jim is what ALL servers should aspire to, we were welcomed at the door an although had no reservations were promptly seated overlooking Michigan Ave. The live Jazz was a welcome surprise and the atmosphere clean and professional. Please do the Cornbread as an appetizer you will not be disappointed. Entrée selection I made because I couldn't make up my mind was the Beef Ribs and Chicken. Will definitely return on our next Chicago visit.

Went here for dinner on a Sunday evening - we had a reservation and were seated right away when we arrived. Both the hostess and our waitress were very friendly. As other Yelpers have noted the restaurant is dark, but I didn't think it was *too* dark. I also didn't find the jazz band to be too loud to carry on a conversation, although we weren't sitting directly next to them. We had the cornbread as an appetizer, and we all highly enjoyed it. As other Yelpers have noted it is served without butter, but it is moist and flavorful enough that butter is not needed. It is a little crumbly but not to the point where it's difficult to eat.  For dinner my friends and I had the bbq beef back ribs, the pork filet, and the fish of the day. Everybody was very happy with their meal. Everything tasted great, portion sizes were generous, and presentation was good too. They were happy to do side substitutions at no extra charge, so I had spinach with my ribs instead of coleslaw. My husband and friend had the Oreo ice cream sandwich for dessert. I'm lactose intolerant so did not partake, but it looked delicious.  My husband and I will definitely go back. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that my husband said that his $13 old fashioned was very watered down. Disappointing to go to such a nice place and drop that much money on a drink and not get your money's worth. In their defense though he didn't send it back and didn't tell them that he was unhappy with it either. I'm sure they would have been happy to remake it or take it off our ticket.  As an aside, the dress code was not as strict as I had believed. I had wanted to go to Bandera last time I visited Chicago but I only had blue jeans and a blouse to wear and was advised by a friend that jeans would not be appropriate. Now that I've been, it would have been fine. In fact we saw a lot of people in athletic wear when we were there.

In  in the chi for the weekend  and wanted to treat a Family friend to a nice dinner. We ended up settling on this place due to another place having an hour-and-a-half wait. I should have known in Chicago it is good to call for reservations on a Saturday night especially a holiday Saturday night. We arrived and the place was packed!  we were told by the hostess that it would be around an hour wait but we could stop by the bar for drinks. The wait turned out not to be an hour, it turned out to be about 25 minutes which was good. Service: The best thing I can say about this restaurant is that their service was impeccable. From the time we stepped into the door, there was a smiling hostess and smiling maitre d. Once we got to our table our waiteress (Michelle I believe) didn't disappoint as well. She was very attentive and took care of all of our needs. She was very nice and open and we really enjoyed the hospitality of the place. The staff worked really well together to take care of each table; sometimes someone else brought us out of refills or someone else brought us our entrees, we really did not have to wait or ask for anything. Ambience The place is beautiful, it's nestled right on Michigan Avenue so very busy busy location.  Inside has a really nice romantic feel, the lights for dinner were dimmed  down low but you can tell that the room was very nicely laid out. One of the things that we really enjoyed was that they had a live piano player who was accompanied by a guitarist.  The pianon guy played beautifully, lots of old songs and new songs of different genres. It was such a nice background to our dinner.  The piano player does accept tips and also accepts request as well and unlike some places where the live musicians get annoyed when people ask for request whenever anyone asked of him he always had a smiling face and let them know that if you would be able to play or not. Food This is the area is where we ended up being disappointed. We ordered an appetizer which was the house-made cornbread. This was very delicious, very plentiful, and one of the highlights of the dinner.  For my entree, I ordered the house special which consisted of baked group with lemon butter sauce, crispy shrimp on top, a side of chive mashed potatoes.  The dish was suppose to come with broccoli, however I was able to sub that for extra mashed  potatoes  at no charge.  The fish was tender but very bland :(  and the lemon butter sauce added no additional  flavor.  I tried putting  pepper on the dish to season it up but that didnt help much.  The mashed potatoes  were mixed in with chive, however, it was over kill and it totally  overpowered the taste of the potatoes.  The dish overall was a disappoint, in addition, it came out Luke warm which is never good. My husband ordered the roasted pork loin that came with the mashed potatoes and red cabbage.  His pork was very delicious (flavorful) and tender.  I think I enjoyed  his dish better than mine lol.  he the cabbage was ok and felt the same about the potatoes  that I did.  Again, his was Luke warm as well.  The pork was the warmest on his plate. Our family friend ordered the French dip sandwich. It tasted ok but again it came out just warm so 5 min into dinner it was cold. Dessert  They had a house made oreo cookie ice cream sandwich.  It came with 2 cookies and was enough  to share.  This was the second  highlight of the meal.  The flavors of the dish blended in very well. Everyone  thought it was very yummy. With 2 glasses of wine, 1 app, 3 entrees, 1 desert; the bill came out to $124 .  Overall, the restaurant  has all the right  qualities to make it a 4 or 5 star, they just need to improve on the food aspect.  We won't  be dinning back due to for the price the food was lackluster and the surplus of restaurant options in Chicago for the same price range.

Food was amazing. I had the new york strip special done medium. Atmosphere was very intimate and great for small groups or dates. My only complaint was that it was a bit warm in the dining area. Everything else was spot on and service was excellent.

I've been here several times and it's always pretty great. Do yourself a favor and do these two things and the rest will work out fine: 1) Order the cornbread as an appetizer! It's the greatest.  2) Ask for a table that is NOT right next to the semi-annoying jazz band. Trust me... The only thing I've had on the menu that wasn't fantastic was the veggie burger. It was kind of mushy. Otherwise everything is spectacular, including the service.  Great place!

Bandera is one of my favorite places to eat.  Great food, great wine list, and a great staff.  I always start with the dip duo appetizer.  Be careful! It is addictive.  It is chips with cheese dip and guacamole.  The staff will be happy to bring you extra chips if you need them. All of the salads are good; my favorite is the macho salad.  It has cornbread croutons and dates, which make the salad one of kind.  I also love the tuna salad, which has a great dressing.  My favorite sandwich is the cheeseburger.  It is one of a kind.  I recommend eating it without making any changes, even though it has lots of stuff on it.

If you must do s chain you must do Bandera when in Chicago (or Rutherford Grill in Napa. Their signature BBQ Beef Ribs with coleslaw and fries (served at both locations) fall off the bones and are simply the best!
Food is very delicious. The atmosphere is excellent. Nice decor and live jazz music. It was well worth the wait.
Great food, music and atmosphere! Order their artichokes when in season! I moved to Seattle and I really miss Bandera! Their salads are amazing and margarita with queso dip is the perfect starter!
Great visit enjoyed the food and music.  I wish yelp  would stop asking for more words
I love this place. I usually being out-of-towners here.  Very relaxed place, great staff, great food.

You really can't go wrong with a Hillstone establishment, but this one is just the best. The staff are so courteous and attentive, and the kitchen staff's attention to quality and detail are impeccable. They deliver consistency on par with Michelin-starred joints.  Additionally, they comped our entire meal once because salads took 20 minutes to come out (in truth we hadn't even noticed)  Annabel was a great server, and embodied all the things we've come to love about frequenting Hillstone establishments everywhere we go!

Perfectly cooked steak!  First...we were visiting Chicago & we didn't decide to try to get reservations for dinner on Friday @ 7pm until Friday afternoon. Using Yelp recommendations, I called a few places without any success. When I phoned Bandera the hostess was so helpful. She said that she didn't have availability at that time but that she would put us at the top of the wait list. I told her "Fine" that we would have cocktails in the bar until a table became available. However, when we arrived they seated us right away. The decor, ambiance & noise level is just right. I hate restaurants were the noise is so much you can't talk without screaming at each other. We started with their signature cornbread appetizer & it was warm & delicious. Three of us ordered the special which was a 16oz New York Strip with fries & a watercress salad. I like a medium rare steak; you know a warm pink center. The steaks were cooked perfectly throughout; from first bite to last.  Everyone was very pleased with their meals. One guy in our party is very needy but the server was never flabbergasted by his demands (although I would have been if I was in her shoes). She was perfect too! I definitely recommend Bandera Restaurant for a great experience.
They are really kind and gentle. Also food was very nice. But if you go here i just recommend wear good dress lol

My husband and I love this place. I can't believe I haven't written a review on it, because this place is my favorite restaurant. It's just casual enough that you don't need to be dressed to the 9's but fancy enough that you can if you want to and you won't look out of place. The lighting is dimmed at night which provides a great ambiance for a date night, or to meet a friend for drinks. The service is amazing. The live jazz band just seals the deal. Every meal we have ever eaten here has not disappointed us. (Tip: if you save room for dessert, go for the house-made Oreo ice cream sandwiches. TO. DIE. FOR.)  I can't say enough good about this place, and we will be coming back time and time again.

Let's just start with this place is a hidden Jem!!  Tuna tartare app was outstanding!  Chicken and ri s melted in my mouth!  And tomato with the most amazing blue cheese!!! Banana cream pie...yum All I can say if you should come here!

Overrated restaurant. Food 2 stars service5 stars. We came here on Fri night without reservation. We expected waiting, they told us 1-1hr. 15mins. I would not pissed if they did not give a table to the couple that came after us and did not have reservation. We seated 1.5hr later however they offered free appetizer after 1hr of waiting. So, we ordered spinach and artichoke dip, which taste like cream spinach. I ordered bbq short ribs.Good but not great. Fries was not hot. My bf ordered pork chop , which was disappointed bland and the cabbage was too sweet.  However, we did impress with their gesture. When Claire asked us how the food was and we said it was ok( with one ribs left over on my plate and side on my bf plate) . The waitress seemed to be very disappointed and felt sad. She was very nice and gave us the free meal plus $100 gift card.

This is definitely an easy to miss place with the restaurant on the 2nd floor, and the entrance at ground level next to a Citibank, but once you're in, you kind of forget that you're eating on one of Chicago's busiest street (Michigan Ave), and instead you'll feel like you've been transported to a different place all-together, with dim lights, live jazz, and great food. With more than a few visits, I've never had anything bad. Service, food, music, atmosphere, etc., is all great. Keep in mind that if you go here without a reservation, you might find yourself waiting a bit... so plan accordingly.

Go for jazz (starts at 6 or 7, please call to confirm). We love the cornbread and corner table in front next to window overlooking Michigan Ave.    steak is the way to go or any of the salads. Great service. We love it here! Prices aren't outrageous.

My wife, a friend and I had dinner last evening.  Based on the high reviews, I expected a wonderful experience.  However, except for the class and well-trained waiter, we were very disappointed, but we'll still give it 3 stars. The corn bread appetizer, which everyone seems to rave about, was tasteless, overly dry and a bomb.  I have had good corn bread before, but this was poor by comparison.  All three of us felt the same and would never order it again.  The two ladies had a masch salad which was very good.   I ordered the Classic Cheeseburger medium rare along with an accompanying side of sauteed spinach.  Here was the problem.  The cheeseburger was presented and was between two slices of what appeared to be a very dry baguette.  Even worse it was piled with lettuce, tomato and onion and was, no kidding, about four inches high!  No way one could eat it without disassembing it and eating it with a knife and fork which I did.  Not only was the cheeseburger just "warm" -- it was and not medium rare but WELL DONE...and inedible.  I called  the waiter over and he totally agreed and apologized, etc.  He did remove it from the bill and also comped us one glass of wine for the problem which was very much appreciated. Sorry to say that Bandera was unable to properly execute a simple cheeseburger.  Whoever was on the grill should be reprimanded.  Unfortunately I will never go back as this restaurant is absolutely nothing special with so many other wonderful restaurants available in the Michigan Avenue area.  First experience...a dud.

I want to update my review I wrote last week. After I posted on Yelp in regards to the service we received, the manager reached out to my sister and I and apologized and actually refunded our entire bill. Went well above and beyond the norm, so I really appreciate it and will be back soon to give Bandera another shot.

Came here for dinner for one while in town on business. The live jazz was perfectly pitched so that people could still talk, but loud enough that a solo person like myself could still enjoy it. I ordered the veggie burger with sautéed spinach on the side. I debated an app and was glad I didn't - the burger was very filling! The burger patty is beet-based so when it arrived it almost looked like a meat patty. Unfortunately the patty itself had very little keeping it together except the gooey cheese on top - my first half of the sandwich went to pieces in my hand. After mopping up with a knife and fork I went to town on the second half. The trick is to leave the little pins holding it together as long as you can, and eat around the edge going for the parts that are in imminent danger of falling apart. The burger overall was good but not life changing. It was missing a certain something...I couldn't truly say what. The buttered burger bun was quite good though. The sautéed spinach on the side was good - not overcooked or soggy, plenty of little garlic bits. Service was great. Attentive and friendly. Was kind enough to leave me a pitcher of water to satisfy the serious drinking problem I have. No complaints here! Seems like a fantastic date spot.

Wow, amazing! I had the Macho salad and I am pretty sure it's the best salad I have ever had! The cornbread croutons were out of this world!!! My husband's french dip was tasty, and his french fries were a perfect side. We were very impressed and would definitely dine here again.

My favorite restaurant in Chicago. Love the ambience; super-love the service--great attitude and great look of servers. Really good and large mixed drinks.  Great views, if you can get the tables overlooking Michigan Avenue.  Last time I was there, I was dining with great people, family from in- and out-of-town.  Bandera, with their quality service, made the experience all the better.  And, the live music--piano is exquisite.  Just perfect! Thanks Bandera for "not shaming" me in front of my peeps!  :)

My family and I came here for my aunt's 25th birthday and it was pretty good overall. I love how while waiting to be seated you can look over to see the kitchen staff cooking and preparing the food. The food was also fantastic, although I expected more from their skillet cornbread. It is sweet so beware! It is a great place to go with a small group or on a date. Make sure to get a table near the window to look out at the street below!

This place was POPPIN for a Friday lunchtime. Probably 80% full? Had a reservation, was seated right away. Waitress was super friendly and provided honest recommendations while  We got some champagne, split the spinach artichoke dip and then each got macho salads.  Champagne- We wanted rose but there was only one champagne not sold by the bottle. So, that was that. It was good though (and their champagne flutes were adorable) Spinach Artichoke Dip- Came with sour cream & salsa which we didn't touch, probably a bit unnecessary in my opinion. The dip itself however was great. Very heavy on the spinach, which didn't make you feel like you were just eating a ton of cheese. Great consistency and would be perfect for a group of 2-3. Any more than that and you may need a second order. Macho Salad- I find myself to be a bit of a salad snob, coming from LA which was land of plentiful salads, but this one was delicious. I work nearby and would totally order this for takeout if possible on days when I`m craving salad. The roasted chicken on it was perfectly flavored and the goat cheese was not overpowering. There was also corn, crutons, fresh avocado, and almonds. I had requested no dates, but my companion said they added a nice sweetness to the dish. I`d definitely come back- great place for a work lunch!

Love this place. It's super busy. Every time I visit Chicago. So glad I was able to visit this time around. The food is fantastic. The. cocktails are amazing. Not over priced. Service is great as well. Make reservations!!  I have not had anything that I did not like on the menu. Live music. Great atmosphere

When I was trying to find a place for lunch, I looked into Bandera and realized they are part of the Hillstone restaurant group, which includes some of my favorite restaurants like Houstons. What a treat. I was able to get my favorite spinach and artichoke dip which, if you have never had, is unbelievable. I love the braised red cabbage too...so delicious! I ordered the salmon which was fresh and an amazing dish. I had such a great meal. The restaurant is on the second floor overlooking Michigan Ave and has a lovely picture window looking over the hustle and bustle of Chicago. The jazz music creates a great ambiance and just completes this classy restaurant. I will return and hope to try the cornbread which I just didn't have room for on this visit.

Bandera is fantastic! I called the restaurant at 9:00pm and was able to make a reservation for 10:15 that night, on a Saturday. Our waiter was very attentive, but not overly present. He was so great! The staff there have perfected the art of paying extra attention to each detail, but not being overbearing to the guests. My S.O and I ordered the smoked salmon appetizer, which was fantastic. He ordered a filet mignon for dinner and I ordered the BBQ Chicken and Beef. The beef just slid off the bone and melted in your mouth. I loved the food. The ambience is very romantic and relaxing too. The music is good, and not too loud. It's easy to hold a conversation and not have to be loud. I know there is live jazz there some days, but we unfortunately missed it. We will definitely be going back another day to catch the live music and have another dinner.

I'm from Los Angeles and go to the Bandera in Brentwood frequently. I was happily surprised to find there was a Bandera on Michigan Avenue in Chicago! I love their BBQ beef ribs so much (maybe even too much)! My service was none other than fantastic which is always to be expected from the Hillstone Restaurant Group.

Nothing special as far as food, and way overpriced for what you're getting. Bread in the sandwich was dry and they really put waaay too much extra stuff in the sandwich (if you get a chicken sandwich you get a small slice of chicken and a crap load of kale salad in the middle.

I was looking for a place where to have a quick bite (on my own), and a drink: I found WAY more: very friendly staff, great drinks, a solid menu (I had the chili, the fish of the day, and the banana cream pie) And my biggest favorite: their LIVE jazz band! Not loud or disruptive, just the perfect touch for an awesome ambiance!

Excellent! Very classy, elegant dining, the service was top notch from the moment we walked in the door. This would be a lovely place for an anniversary celebration, but we had 3 children with  us and it was just as nice with them. The waiter told us about a kid friendly chicken sandwich that wasn't on the menu for our picky eater, and she devoured it. I don't know what oil they fry with but I couldn't help stealing bites from her plate! The servings are enormous, I could easily have shared the prime rib plate with another person and we both would've been full. All ingredients were fresh, seasonings just right, a perfect dining experience!

A beautiful restaurant, fully staffed bar, with great jazz.  The drinks and menu are insanely awesome. Had the cornbread and  BBQ ribs.  Both were excellent! Had to have Oreo cookie chocolate dessert. Divine!!

I was pleasantly surprised at this Houston owned restaurant perched atop Michigan Ave. The atmosphere is very cozy and rustic and dark lighting. I ordered the Kale and roasted chicken salad that was delicious! Everyone at our table loved their meal, from the prime rib, Dutch country chicken,and the roasted pork filet with all delicious sides. The say the iron skillet cornbread is a signature and a must,personally I would pass it was bland and dry.The wine list by the glass is not very good but they make a nice cocktail.

Came here for the first time last week as a surprise dinner. it was around 5:30 when we arrived and there weren't many people. We were seated immediately at a table facing out toward Michigan Ave which was nice. The two waitresses that we had were very attentive and friendly. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, chicken tortilla soup and we both had the prime rib french dip.  Spinach and artichoke dip was good.. Do feel like there could have been more for the price paid but it came with a side of salsa, sour cream and unlimited amount of tortilla chips.  The chicken tortilla soup was really good! It had really good flavors and tasted as if it was simmering for a very long time. It honestly might be the most memorable dish of the night..  When I think about French dip I will always and forever compare it to Phillipes back home in LA. Being prime rib slices, you would expect the meat to be more tender! The au jus it came with was pretty good but I think the bread was my least favorite thing.. There is a fine line between being toasted and just dry and old.. and I thought the bread was dry and old. Had to basically submerge the bread in the jus for a while to get it to soften up! Fries were nice and crispy but honestly, the horseradish aioli or whatever it came with was so good. Definitely was the highlight of the dish.  I guess I will have to try other things on the menu and update my review when that happens but in the meantime.. just A-OK.

This is hands down my most recommended place to eat downtown. The food us phenomenal, the staff is always super accommodating, and the ambiance is very relaxing. Can you tell I like it? Haha. But the kale chicken salad is definitely worth the trip.

I would give this place 10 stars if I could. I was first here several months ago with my parents while they were in town visiting. They loved the live jazz music and ambiance of the restaurant. We had their famous cornbread as our appetizer and we loved it.  Overall, we felt we got classy Chicago experience without completely breaking the bank. So this weekend while I had girlfriends in town we headed over to Bandera.  We were enjoying ourselves so much we had completely forgotten to make reservations. We were told it would be about an hour wait.  We gave them our number and continued to shop on the magnificent mile while we waited for a table to become available. When we came back an hour later a table was still not available. It wasn't the hostesses fault, people just didn't want to leave because the music was so good!  The hostess was so incredibly nice and apologetic about the situation and offered us a free appetizer.  We got the salmon with bread which we all agreed was amazing! Once we were seated we all agreed the food was worth the wait! I got the southwest salad with corn, dates, and goat cheese. We were so stuffed when we were done but we still managed to make room for banana cream pie and Oreo pie dessert.  I highly recommend giving this place a try.

Perfect ambience, great place to meet with friends or chill with an after work drink. I met up with friends for a Thursday night dinner and got to enjoy some live jazz. The staff were friendly, prompt, and professional and had great recommendations for dinner. I ordered the white fish dish and split a bottle of red wine with my friends. For starters, we tried the duo dip which was unfortunately a tad too salty for our taste. When our waiter found out however, he was quick to recommend a replacement (smoked salmon) and got it for us on the house. So very nice of him! It was definitely a much better option and we were happy. Entrees didn't follow too far behind; my friends ordered the prime rib and prime filet and shared some with everyone - delicious! I was wanting their food by the end of the night. One of my friends was new to the city and mentioned this to the waiter, and guess what...he brought her dessert on the house! Overall, fab dinner experience in a great environment. Will have to return for more of the ambience and that prime filet! Mmmmm.

This place is amazing. Paying more for the location/ambiance and definitely a good celebration type dinner place. There is a restaurant in lake view, called Crosby's Kitchen, that has basically the same menu, but not as expensive. Bandera is the fancier higher-end downtown Crosby's.  Spinach dip, kale salad and ahi tuna salad all delicious.
Great place to have dinner on Michigan. The food was very good and fresh. The roasted chicken was not dry and the fish was fresh. It's kinda dark and music was a bit too loud. Good place overall.
Great date night spot away from the Hubbard crowd scene! Great atmosphere, awesome food and service! Love the ambiance! Really a classic place and miss it! Hopefully going back soon :)
Great Lighting, great acoustics, great JAZZ!  Oh, and the food is delicious.

Good food overall. Classic American choices, such as hamburgers, Caesar salad, French dip and chicken fingers. They take easy classics are make them in to fancier dishes. I went with a large group to celebrate a birthday and do not know if I would recommend that. The restaurant presents a fancier and quitter appearance, so loud 20 year olds celebrating a birthday was probably not the best mixture. The spinach and artichoke dip, chicken fingers and the veggie burger are all of my favorites.
This place is spectacular !!! Service was excellent and so was the food. I will come back from NY to have it again !!! I truly recommend it !!

This place is just at the top of nice fan Ave, it's not that easy to find as its in the 2nd floor via escalator. Once inside the place looks great , nice selection of dishes to choose from , my favorite so far is the ahi tuna salad. Very refreshing when you want a healthy option or something not too heavy.

Their signature Cornbread is dry. It needs butter. Their Apple cobbler has too many pecans not enough  apples. But their Kobe Beef with cheese enchilada is outstanding! Apparently, you can order just the enchilada at lunch and they do run out of it! Best enchilada sauce ever!
I had my bday party there on Saturday night and I enjoyed the ambiance, service, food and drinks very much !!!! My friends and I had so much fun and I would totally go back :)

If you've been to a Hillstone restaurant in the past you've already been to Bandera. This is essentially a Houston's with a few different menu items and Southwestern inspired art. Having said that I enjoy Houston's and I'm happy to see the same Ahi tuna salad on the menu at Bandera. Service was good and the live jazz music is big plus. I've only been late in the evening so I can't comment on peak hours, but given the restaurant's second floor rather than street level location it may be safe to assume that this is slightly less touristy than other restaurants in the area.
They are extremely professional and kind to their customers. The pork chop and salmon was cooked perfectly and tasted spectacular. I also love being able to look out the window down on Chicago ave.

I love the dark comfy mood of the place, very cozy. All the food is great, but the BEST dish in the menu are definitely the BBQ ribs. INCREDIBLE. I've had the ribs, the salmon, and the burger (which was meh, good). And for dessert the oreo sandwich (dont think twice it's awesome).

Very good place for a work / business lunch.  It's kind of dark in there, but definitely has a 'fancy' vibe to it.  If you're coming for lunch, get the prime rib french dip sandwich.  I had it a while ago, but I still daydream about it. It might not look appealing from the outside and it might be hard to spot, but the inside and the food is very legit.

The kale, chicken, and peanut salad is to die for!  Ive never come across a salad that i could live off of...but i have now!  My husband had the chicken sandwhich...pretty sure the bread was from heaven itself! Food prices are pretty reasonable and the drinks are too considering that they are made very strong!
Ate at the bar, great service, delicious cocktails. Tuna poke, black bean soup (lukewarm but they gladly reheated) delicious veggie burger!!!

Awesome service throughout. Great atmosphere. No valet so be prepared to park a block away - will validate for $16 parking. We had the Caesar, pine salads, BBQ salmon and fish of the day - all DELICIOUS, especially the Cajun shrimp! Oreo ice cream sandwich was the best part for my husband - next time we'll try the banana cream pie. Old fashioned was a bit watered down for my taste, but wine selection was good. Very highly recommend.

What could you ask for?! A gorgeous white tablecloth restaurant with exceptional food and live jazz band playing in the corner was what we needed!  I am gonna be straight up honest with you: go for the aged & season prime ribs. Oh. Em. Gee! I ordered it medium and I can not start to explain the thoughts going through my head as I savored the delicious piece of meat! *insert party music for the stomach*  The brussel sprouts were nice and crunchy; would have liked it if it was cooked a little bit longer.  My friend ordered the meat loaf and wasn't too big on it. I like it. It was meaty..if you know what I mean. Lol. It wasn't grounded meat that you couldn't actually taste the texture.  The iron skillet cornbread was random...but actually very good! It was even better at the end of the night! Lol

Love this place!  I've been dining at Bandera almost weekly for the past year and come back again and again.  It's hard to beat Bandera for the ambiance, live jazz, friendly staff, attentive service and great food.  And it's overlooking glittering and vibrant Michigan Avenue.  What's not to love?  The Paul Martin Trio on Wednesday nights is outstanding.  Some menu items definitely worth trying:  the Kale salad, great flavor with a little kick;  French Dip sandwich is delicious;  main menu items BBQ Salmon, Spit Roasted Pork Filet, Prime Filet and Prime Rib are all wonderful.  If you typically like your steak medium rare, I would suggest trying the filet rare-plus.  It's awesome!  And at $42, including two sides, it just might be the best deal in Chicago.  As far as sides, the sautéed spinach, mashed potatoes or braised red cabbage are very nice compliments to the meal.  For dessert (if you still have room!), the Apple Walnut Cobbler with a cappuccino hits the spot!  If you're hanging out at the bar, ask Sam, Nicole, Emily, Anna or any of the fabulous staff to make you one of their outstanding Side Cars or Old Fashions with top shelf ingredients and fresh squeezed juices.  They are very busy 6-9pm, so reservations are highly recommended.

Premise/Intro: A very attractive place with food to go with the gorgeous ambiance.  Located on gorgeous Michigan Avenue you will not be disappointed in this succulent place.  Decor: Just plain classic beauty with the layout and hot jazz music. I tell you this place is the essence of Chicago style and feel.  Anybody woild be crazy not come to this place if you're it visiting Chicago let alone living in Chicago.  This place should be on everybody's top 10 favorites list in Chicago  Service: Service was great and impeccanke. Everytime I came here it was also sweet and to the point.  Waiters are absolutely the kindest and always curteous. They're one of the reasons why I come to this place.  Food/Product: I always get the half chicken with mashed potatoes and vegetables.  If I do a dessert it's the ice cream placed between two cookie sheets and drizzled with chocolate sauce.  Absolutely divine.  I've had friends who have ordered all different things and they always love it   Price: Definitely not bad for what you order here.  It can be typical pricier than the Cheesecake Factory but it shows in their quality of food, ambiance and entertainment for sure.  Overall experience/Conclusion: I'd definitely come back here again in a heart beat.  The place is the perfect essence of Chicago.  It resonates style, Chicago flavors and sounds.  A must eat for sure. Enjoy!

My boyfriend and i came to dinner a few days ago and we read all the reviews here. Based on the reviews, a lot of people recommended the MACHO SALAD. The ingredients are very unique which is why i wasn't sure about it. But i am so glad I ordered it because it was DELICIOUS!!!! I can't wait to go back and order it again :) my boyfriend got the Snake River Farms Tri-Tip & Butternut White Cheddar Enchilada and it was also good! TONS of peppers so be advised! Also based on the reviews here, we ordered the Oreo dessert and it was really good! My boyfriend and i were stuffed after our meals so maybe thats why we didn't (or couldn't) appreciate it much. Love the jazz music and the atmosphere. We will be back!

Very very nice spot. Came here for midday snack and drinks. Our server was Michele , very attentive, patient and knowledgable. The burger was enormous size (almost like 2 burgers in 1). I tried wild rice vinaigrette and red cabbage from sides all was delicious. Drinks were good too !

If you're looking for an upscale place to eat on Michigan Ave, this is a good one. It's located on the 2nd floor, across the escalator from a Men's Wearhouse so I had some trouble finding it at first. Upon entering, I was taken aback at first by the candlelit, dark wooden decor, but it was not as pretentious as it seemed.  Service was on the slower side, but still attentive and helpful. We started with the Skillet Cornbread, which was amazing - the buttery flaky crust that bubbles over is the perfect contrast to the moist and delicious center. I was also happy with the White Cheddar and Butternut Enchiladas. Portions were pretty large for all of our entrees, so we didn't have enough room for the Oreo Ice Cream Sandwiches - I'll definitely try them next time!

Macho salad is awesome. I swapped out the goat cheese for a cheddar jack combination. The service is pretty great and they have a really good drink menu. You should definitely bring a small group as the restaurant is really intimate.
Nice service and great food.i been there few times. I recommend it. I will return again and again

We went here last night for our Anniversary and we will definitely be eating here again. We had a few mishaps with the table not being ready, and with them being out of a few of the things we had ordered. However they were incredibly gracious and ended up taking care of our entire meal! Our Server Emily, along with the rest of the staff we encountered were all very nice and attentive. The food was delicious and their Crisp Martini is my new favorite cocktail. 5  stars and a big thanks to Emily and the rest of the staff that made our anniversary dinner so perfect!

I recommend you get a reservation here as this place fills up fast. Wait time at 6pm Saturday night was 1 hr. Restaurant is very well setup, great atmosphere and live jazz music.  The menu was simple and listed on one page, no fluff and to the point - sign of a good focused kitchen.  The food came out quick and tasted fantastic. I had the Very Fresh Fish of the Day (Cod) with  Shrimp, Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli. Partner had the Tuna Salad. We were both very happy in what we ordered. Our one complaint is wishing the food portions were a little bigger.
LOVE this place.  Everyone's in a booth.  Superb soft lighting.  Great food and service.  Jazz quartets or live piano.  Overlooks The Mag Mile.  MAKE A RESERVATION.  It's usually packed.

I have eaten here twice in the last 2 weeks, the food is not what it used to be, inedible, cold stale fries, fish sandwich and Cole slaw which tasted of refrigerator and lame over priced salads, even the cornbread was dry and tasteless. My plates were completely full when the server came to clear them away, didn't ask me if I enjoyed my meal, which obviously I had not. Will never go back again.

On vacation here in chicagao and i absolutely loved this place! Highly recommend the cornbread and the homemade ice cream sandwich! Very upscale and classy! I sat at the bar and the hospitality was great! Bartenders were on point!

Went with my friend a couple of days ago when we didn't want to wait 40 minutes at the Purple Pig. We ended up being very glad the PP couldn't take us! The Macho Salad (roasted chicken, mixed greens, avocado, dates, goat cheese, toasted almonds) was delicious!! The only part of the salad I didn't love were the cornbread croutons, but I'm not really a crouton  fan. My friend had the Classic Caesar and soup of the day (Black Bean) and was equally happy. Nice atmosphere, good service - will definitely go back.

I would give 0 star if I don't have to give them at least one on Yelp.  Me and my gf waited for over 40 mins. I had a reservation at 7:30pm. We didn't get seated until 8pm. No apology whatsoever.   Worst come to worst, service was a disaster too.  After we finished our  iced water, no severs even came to fill it up.  Food was only OK.   All these negatives accumulate, earning this place a solid 0 star (I don't wanna even give them one star). Too bad that this place has such a high rating. More ppl are gonna fall into the trap.  Thank you but no thank you bandera! Won't ever come again.

This is a classy, cute restaurant with a great location on Michigan Ave. I had been here once before and had a bowl of amazing chicken tortilla soup, so I got their soup of the day today, which was a chicken chili. It was good but the chicken tortilla soup last time was better. Everyone was slightly disappointed with their entrees, especially the lamb sandwich and the veggie burger. I liked my soup and salad so I'm giving four stars and I would definitely go back and try other stuff on the menu!

After reading reviews of local restaurants this one popped up on my radar. I was looking for great ambience and I must say this place exceeded all my expectations. Walked in to friendly staff, an excellent (not too loud) live jazz band, and a warm welcoming ambience. During the 45 minute wait for our table I observed the servers and hostesses who all were very professional and focused, like a well oiled machine. Very well run restaurant!! After being seated I looked around again, and thought to myself YES!! Finally I've found what I was looking for! My wife and I split the macho salad, which was the best salad I've ever had. Our waitress was excellent! She was very attentive and even recommended a Pinot Noir which was fantastic and one of our new favorites. The oreo desert was to die for! Anyway, I cant say enough about how much we enjoyed this place and it takes a lot to impress me. Thank you Bandera!

We loved the Food and live music the first time we  went to Banderas. However, on our last visit we had an unpleasant encounter with the bar manager who refused to accept our foreign id's although this didn't appear to be An issue on our previous visits. Apparently, tourists are not welcome in this restaurant.
