This is a good place to take a break while power shopping down Michigan Ave. The atmosphere is very relaxed. The chicken is what they are known for and is very tasty. The Hacked Chicken Salad is excellent.

Ok so it's a decent place for meats, rotisserie and otherwise.  But I can't get THAT excited about it.  It's your typical meat & potatoes & different-types-of-grilled-meats-on-salads type place.   Decent, but nothing to freak out about. Am I that hard to impress? I don't think so!

All in all, had a great dinner here.  Pretty simple menu, but the food was great.  My wife got the rotisserie chicken, which was some of the best chicken either of us have ever had.  I also enjoyed the atmosphere and service was above average.  I highly recommend.

I wouldn't call Bandera hip or trendy.  It seems to be mostly suit and tie clientele for business lunches or after dinner lunches.  Nothing says unhip like a room full of suited people.  I've been here a handful of times on business lunches, in fact, because this is what they mainly cater to (and for that purpose, it works). I rarely end up here for dinner, and after one experience, I wouldn't again on purpose. We ordered the artichoke for an appetizer.  While it was very good, I was annoyed when the waitor came by 3 minutes after we received it to explain how to eat it, as if I had never eaten artichoke before.  Its not like we were just staring blankly at it not sure what to do with it. We were further annoyed when the expeditor came and dropped off our entrees 2 minutes later (so in total no more than 5 minutes after we got our appetizer).    Hello, can't you tell we're not even half way done with our appetizer?  This to me is absolutely unacceptable and probably one of the worst things a restaurant can do.  10 minutes later (eating a giant artichoke is fairly time consuming) we were ready to eat our barely warm entrees.  It's not like we could even complain, because the server never came back to ask how everything was until we were clearly ready for more drinks and/or our check.   When he did finally come back, we were finally able to ask for water in addition to our drinks.   Just about EVERY entree on the menu is loaded and glazed with sugar.  The night I went all of the specials came with your choice of maple syrup glazed carrots OR braised cabbage.  Thinking the braised cabbage was the smarter choice health-wise, my dining partner and I both picked it.  The cabbage came and was more like caramelized cabbage than braised.  It tasted like it was braised in corn syrup and vinegar, not just wine or whatever one might expect.  My pork entree-which mentioned nothing of a glaze--came and was glazed in some sort of thick honey sauce.   It reminded me of something they'd serve at Applebees. Outside of the very simply prepared artichoke, the food itself wasn't anything spectacular.  To me any restaurant that needs to drench everything in thick sauces (a la TGIFs) is trying to cover up poorly prepared dishes. As soon as the check was about to be delivered, the waitor started being very attentive and tried to make us forget that everything up until then was pretty mediocre (even though we never actually told him, since by the time he really came back it was too late anyway). This place has live jazz music every night.  Just make sure that when getting a table, you aren't seated directly next to the quartet, or you'll be lucky to hear yourself cough.  I'm not complaining about the live music--its great--but for dining its a little loud. Honestly, I wouldn't expect service at TGIF's to be this lacking.  At over $100 for 2 entrees, one appetizer, and 2-3 drinks (total, not per person), the place isn't the cheapest place in the world for what it is, either.  Go to Bandera if you go out every night of your life and haven't tried it, but certainly don't go there hoping to have a nice date or something.

This is pretty much my favorite place to go for a lunch date during the week.  The restaurant is pleasing to the eye, and although I've never tried anything but the Prime Rib French Dip sandwich, I can assure you that I've never heard anyone with complaints.  The service is friendly and quick (which is sometimes disappointing on a work day when I'm trying to stay out to lunch as long as possible).  Despite the fact that it is a bit pricey, I've always found it worth it.  My only suggestion is that you get there about 15 minutes before noon in order to beat the crowd.  This may also guarantee you a seat against the window, allowing for people watching down onto Michigan Ave.

EXCELLENT FOOD!!! YUMMMMMMMMMMYYYYY!!!! I'm not a vegetarian but just for kicks i tried their veggie burger amazing...and the Oreo ice cream sandwich amazing it was pretty damn good....mmmmmmmmm I've tried to go there a couple times and it is mega crowded.....as well as it being a great restaurant the enviornament is laid back and kinda dark...Loungy and live music which is nice...men are not allowed to wear short sleeves (thank you romeo) we got turned around cause my boyfriend had on short sleeves....MAKE RESERVATIONS...its a pretty popular restaurant
Great salads and good people watching if you can get a table that overlooks Michigan Ave.

It is on Michigan Avenue ... in the busy tourist portion, which makes me fear walking over there.  However, the Macho Salad and well made bloody mary's made it worth it for me this weekend. I was with my boyfriend and we were both surprised by how much we enjoyed the meal having forgotten about it for a long time.   Great for a stop in after shopping at Nordstroms and before heading back to the reality of Chicago on weekends and I would think this would be a wonderful lunch spot (although I never made it here even when working two blocks down). Macho Salad has chicken and goat cheese and all sorts of goodness!

I've only been here for lunch numerous times.  Their salads have been filing and have some flair to them.  I've yet to order a non-salad dish, but the prices do jump a lot from lunch to dinner. Also, the waitstaff at the bar are incredibly friendly.

the hostess maintained an effortless "today is fantastic!" demeanor despite the underfed, overweight tourists devising her death, yes on a friday at noon there is going to be a wait. but it only took 20 minutes for us to be seated in front of a delightful server who had us fed, floating and out the door in 35 minutes. the american home cookin is exaclty what the doctor ordered after an evening of 4 too many glasses of wine. they will put anything and everything on the side without so much as the thought of an eyeroll. my skinny pants thank them for that. it's a Chicago staple and i recommend it highly only because time and time again the staff has treated me perfectly and the food is predictably good.
Nice atmosphere- reminds me a lot of Houston's and I think they have the same owner. I had a salad for lunch here that was pretty good, but the best thing was the cornbread appetizer.

There are probably a few better restaurants in Chicago.  But few have cuisine that "hits the spot" as well as Bandera.  I've heard  their menu referred to as "Contemporary American Comfort Food", and I'd say that's accurate.  Everything was very flavorful, the sides were extremely fresh and complimented the meal very well.  The jazz was even good, and I am not a jazz lover.  I really liked the decor as well.

I love going to this comfort food restaurant when it's chilly outside.  Nothing beats their rotisserie chicken and a glass of wine to wash it down!  I really love sitting near the window (if I get lucky enough!) and people watching down on Michigan Ave.  I love their mashed potatoes too!

The main reason I go is because of their amazing cornbread, and their live jazz band.  If they seat you near the windows, you get an awesome view of Michigan Ave. while dining. The fare is standard American food, but I have to admit, the hamburgers were pretty good.  Though a bit pricey, the ambience and food is enough to keep you there.
Nothing special about this restaurant, the menu is pretty typical american food but i must say its good.  its the perfect place to go when you don't know where else to go

I've been to Bandera twice, but I can't say much about it.  The food seems pretty normal to me, nothing special.  Their prices are also high.  Their lunch menu is pretty small with not a ton of options besides giant burgers/sandwiches or roasted chickens or big pieces of meat.

If you are lucky enough to get a window seat, the views and people watching on the Mag Mile are great.  Otherwise, you will have to just sit back and enjoy their great food, which isn't a problem in any capacity!  The portions are huge and the comfort food is very good.   I highly recommend the roast chicken and this great chili cheese dip appetizer.  Yummy!

Great food, great service. We had the ribs and chicken. Both were tasty. Our server was very friendly and attentive. We had the unfortunate luck of being sat next to the kitchen, but other than that, we were extremely pleased. Make reservations or plan for a wait!

A great restaurant to spice up anyones mood.  It's always packed with hungry eaters.  The restaurant is a bit dim with with many tables and waiteres and waitresses running around.  The menu is pretty big with lots and lots of choices.  I especially liked the chicken roast...delicious!

This restaurant is just bad.  The chilli tastes like vomit.  The artichokes are cut in such a way that eating them is like putting a knife in your mouth.  I actually left this restaurant bleeding.  Still planning on going here?  Fine.  Suit yourself!

This is a great place to stop for lunch (the prices are better) if you're downtown and want something a little nicer. Try the cornbread and you must get the black bean chili. For the love, GET THE CHILI! It will change your life.

The atmosphere was really cozy and we were right next to a live jazz band which added to the whole feel of the restaurant.  The food was really filling - the cornbread has a little bit of jalapeno in it which makes it really good; I really like their ribs and chicken, too.  And their salads are HUGE which makes me feel like I'm eating a very healthy meal.
